title: Manager, Brand Research
description:
**About Us:**
-------------



DailyPay, Inc. is transforming the way people get paid. As the industry's leading on-demand pay solution, DailyPay uses an award-winning technology platform to help America's top employers build stronger relationships with their employees. This voluntary employee benefit enables workers everywhere to feel more motivated to work harder and stay longer on the job, while supporting their financial well-being outside of the workplace. DailyPay is headquartered in New York City, with operations in Minneapolis and Belfast. For more information, visit DailyPay's Press Center.

**The Role:**
-------------



As part of the Marketing Team, the Brand Research Manager helps inform business, marketing and communications decisions by uncovering insights about our key audiences. Responsibilities include quantitative and qualitative research, including design, execution, data analysis and reporting. Your findings on audience perceptions, decision-drivers, needs, preferences and characteristics are a driving force behind our marketing initiatives.



If this opportunity excites you, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the qualifications.


**How You Will Make an Impact:**
--------------------------------


* Design research end-to-end, choose appropriate methodologies based on goals, timelines, budget
* Write questionnaires (surveys, question guides)
* Program, test and run surveys in survey platforms
* Analyze results in survey platforms, cross tabbing tools, data tables with a critical eye towards data quality, methods and intent
* Identify and investigate trends, outliers, narratives and "aha!" moments in data
* Design and manage qualitative research
* Reporting based on key narratives, stakeholders

**What You Bring to The Team:**
-------------------------------


* 5+ years of experience in market research, including survey design, data analysis and reporting
* Understanding of market research methodologies and statistical methods
* Ability to design research methodologies, write questionnaires, execute and report on research (experience managing full span of the research process)
* Have a voice in meetings
* Detail-oriented with ability to communicate big picture
* Understanding of marketing strategies and goals
* Curiosity and proactive drive to question trends, dig deeper into insights and improve processes

**What We Offer:**
------------------


* Exceptional health, vision, and dental care
* Opportunity for equity ownership
* Life and AD&D, short- and long-term disability
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Resource Groups
* Fun company outings and events
* Unlimited PTO
* 401K with company match

 **Pay Transparency.** DailyPay takes a market-based approach to compensation and compensation may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into two tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The salary ranges are listed by geographic tier. Additionally, this role may be eligible for variable incentive compensation in addition to stock options. Where a candidate fits within the compensation range for a role is based on their demonstrated experience, qualifications, skills and internal equity.

**National Compensation Range**


$100,000—$130,000 USD**Premium Compensation Range**


$111,000—$144,000 USD  


DailyPay is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable culture of belonging, grounded in empathy and respect, which values openness to opinions, awareness of lived experiences, fair treatment and access for all. We strive to build and develop diverse teams to create an organization where innovation thrives, where the full potential of each person is engaged, and their views, beliefs and values are integrated into our ways of working.



We encourage people of all backgrounds to join us on our mission. If you require reasonable accommodation for any aspect of the recruitment process, please send a request to peopleops@dailypay.com. All requests for accommodation will be addressed as confidentially as practicable.



DailyPay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion or creed, alienage or citizenship status, political affiliation, marital or partnership status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, childbirth (or related medical conditions), sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, genetic disorder, genetic predisposition, carrier status, military status, familial status, or domestic violence victim status and any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

title: Social Media Coordinator Manager Internship for Credit / National Beauty Brand
description:
Job Overview:

Please note: This position is not compensated and is offered solely for college/university CREDIT.

We are seeking a Social Media Manager Intern to join our team @ NuRevealSkincare.com. As a Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing social media strategies to increase brand awareness, engage with our target audience, and drive traffic to our website. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on our digital presence and contribute to the growth of our organization.

Duties:  
- Develop and execute social media strategies to drive brand awareness and engagement  
- Manage social media on Instagram  
- Create and curate engaging content for social media posts  
- Monitor social media trends and stay up-to-date with industry best practices  
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure consistent messaging across all channels  
- Analyze social media data and generate reports on key metrics  
- Engage with followers, respond to comments and messages in a timely manner  
- Stay informed about industry trends, new platforms, and emerging technologies

Skills:

- Fluent English speaker  
- Strong relationship management skills to engage with followers and build a loyal community  
- Experience in advertising on social media platforms  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a keen eye for detail  
- Knowledge of proofreading techniques to ensure error-free content  
- Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and strategies for driving online sales  
- Basic graphic design skills using Canva

If you are passionate about social media, have a creative mindset, and enjoy staying up-to-date with the latest trends, we would love to hear from you. Join our team as a Social Media Manager and help us take our digital presence to the next level.

Please note that this is a remote position.

This role is for college/university credit only. We will fill out the paperwork necessary.

Email: content@nureveal.com

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $44,453.93 - $53,535.91 per year

Expected hours: 5 per week

Experience:

* Social media marketing: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Marketing
description:
At Miaplaza, our vision is to make online learning more effective than ever before. We apply the most successful approaches in virtual education to create online learning platforms where students from different backgrounds can be successful. Our platforms, Miacademy for K-8 and MiaPrep for high school students, are designed to cater to diverse educational needs, including those of kids with learning disabilities.

Miaplaza embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Our student base is growing rapidly and we are currently hiring for multiple positions across several departments! Our expansion stems from two key factors: our commitment to providing exceptional educational content to our students by scaling our team with passionate individuals, and our pursuit of new opportunities to enhance our students' learning experiences by broadening our capabilities and expertise as an organization.

You can hear our CEO, Johannes Ziegler, discuss our company in this podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mabdbqbSco&t=23s&ab\\_channel=Universit%C3%A4tStuttgart.

We are seeking an experienced, resourceful, hands-on marketing professional who can drive Miaplaza’s advertising, brand-building, and SEO initiatives. The Director of Marketing manages and grows the marketing team and works closely with senior management and our product and content teams to build world-class K-12 education services and solutions. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of Facebook and Google advertising, is comfortable working with data analytics and marketing metrics, and brings an appreciation for the unique requirements of online education marketing.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Online Marketing & Paid Advertising

* Develop and manage paid advertising campaigns across various platforms (e.g., Facebook Ads, Google Ads, YouTube Ads) to reach parents, educators, and students effectively and efficiently.
* Analyze campaign performance data and optimize campaigns and budgets based on key metrics (e.g., cost-per-acquisition, conversion rate, return on investment).
* Stay up-to-date on best practices for online advertising platforms and adapt strategies accordingly.
* Experiment with new ad formats and targeting options to maximize reach and engagement.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive SEO strategy.
* Identify and leverage partnerships with relevant online communities and influencers.

User Acquisition

* Lead and manage user acquisition campaigns across various channels (e.g., paid advertising, organic search, content marketing, partnerships).
* Analyze marketing data and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize campaigns.
* Collaborate with the product development team to ensure effective messaging and positioning of new offerings.

Brand Management & Communications

* Build and strengthen the Miaplaza brand identity and reputation.
* Develop and manage comprehensive communication strategies across all channels (e.g., website, social media, email, public relations).
* Oversee the creation of high-quality marketing materials, including website content, blog posts, social media posts, email campaigns, and press releases.

Strategic Leadership

* Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy aligned with Miaplaza's vision and growth objectives.
* Manage our current marketing team and grow the department.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities and threats, and inform strategic decisions.
* Stay informed about emerging trends in online education and marketing technology to ensure Miaplaza stays competitive and innovative.
* Employ first-principles thinking to gain a deep understanding of core objectives and customer needs, while critically assessing and challenging both existing approaches and conventional marketing wisdom.

**Requirements:**

* Full-time availability
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Technology or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years’ experience in online marketing, paid online advertising and SEO.
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting.
* Strong writing and editing skills.
* Experience with managing other marketing professionals.
* Understanding of the EdTech space and its trends is a plus.
* Passion for education and a commitment to improving learning outcomes.

**Benefits:** We offer health, dental, and vision insurance for all full-time employees! Our health insurance also includes specialty care like fertility benefits and chiropractic care. We want our employees to have the care and support they need.

* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* 401(k) with employer matching
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Employee discounts
* Paid floating holidays
* Tuition assistance

Please include a cover letter detailing why you would be a good candidate for this position, a resume, and professional references.

**Job Type:** Full-time, exempt employee

**Salary:** $80,000 - $120,000 annual salary

**Work Location:** Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

title: Associate Manager, Product Development Private Brands (Must have Retail/Grocery/Big Box skills)
description:
**Job Summary**

The primary purpose of this position is to support the Product Development Director in achieving the goals and objectives regarding assortment, sales, markdowns, margin, net profit, and inventory for a portfolio of product categories. Build private brand offering and increase sales and penetration through package design, product assortment. positioning, and promotion. Develops robust partnerships with suppliers and internal stakeholders, including Category Management, Merchandising, Marketing and Operations.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop private brand offering and increase sales and penetration through package design, product assortment. positioning, and promotion.
* Develop and manage Own Brand advertising and monthly planning calendar for team.
* Partner on creative development and package design process for each own brand product line, in partnership with design agencies, suppliers, and merchandising team. Ensure adherence to brand standards and reintroduction timelines.
* Work collaboratively with category management team to develop assortment and positioning plans to increase own brand penetration
* Develop and maintain strong supplier relationships; hold suppliers accountable to performance agreements and implement course corrections and mitigation strategies as needed.
* Completes forms and templates for various business needs for supplier item set ups and RFQs
* Develops assigned categories; stays abreast of category trends and market changes. Maintains knowledge of competition and applies information as necessary to grow sales and profit.
* Knows how to forecast demand for both short-term and long-term sales; must have a solid understanding of logistics and the effect on store and warehouse fill rates, inventory, and shelf life, and the results these areas have on category profitability.
* Participate in annual category strategy review, support the development of plan-o-grams, and coordinate implementation by product categories.
* Leverages Rite Aid customer data to drive decisions. Ensures that insights and learnings are executed and that best practices are shared/leveraged within the organization.

**Qualifications**

**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS**

**Education Level**

**Area of Specialization (Marketing, Finance, Pharmacy, Engineering/IT, etc)**

**Required or Preferred**

Bachelor Degree

Business, Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain or related

Required

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

**Required or Preferred**

Results-oriented leader with proven strategic thinking, planning, and analytical skills

Required

Excellent financial and business acumen

Required

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Required

Action-orientated and a results-focused mindset.

Required

Possess the ability to connect with the merchandising organization and be able to convert opportunities into practical business strategies.

Required

**WORK EXPERIENCE**

**Experience**

3 years of experience in leading in retail private brands, merchandising, and/or buying

Preferred

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING MANAGER - YOUR VIRTUAL UPLINE**

**Position Overview**

Do you love creating content and marketing? Are compelling Instagram captions and social strategy your love languages? Are you a dynamic individual with a flair for social media, and a heart for impactful communication? If so, you’re in the right place!

We're looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who resonates with our core values of love, service, and growth. Love, Serve, Grow™ is not only the name of our signature program, but the guiding philosophy of everything we do as a company.

In our business, love is more than an emotion; it's a guiding principle in how we engage with our community, and each other. Service is at the core of our mission, driving us to create content that genuinely impacts people, and transforms their lives.

We're committed to growth, not just in our business metrics, but in the personal and professional development of our community, paid clients, and our team. If you are someone that values these things, is looking to make a real difference in the world of social media marketing, and grow with a team that cares, we would love to meet you!

We’re looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who understands that social media isn’t all about likes and comments, it’s about moving the needle, making an impact, creating brand awareness, and most importantly — finding ways to attract and engage our ideal audience so that they become raving fans and customers.

This position’s primary focus will be to expand the reach of our business, brand, podcast, and online training programs by strategizing, creating, distributing, and curating engaging content for our audience through various social media channels.

This is a full-time position — please don’t apply if you have other clients or manage a virtual assistant or marketing agency. You’ll report directly to our Founder Bob Heilig, while also working closely with other key members of the team.

The Social Media Marketing Manager position will be mostly a work from home, virtual position. However in-person collaboration will be required a few times per year. We meet in person to develop our marketing strategy, and flesh out our execution plans.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

Our Social Media Marketing Manager will primarily be responsible for:

STRATEGY

* **Social Media Growth**: Developing strategies to grow our social media platforms both in customer engagement and numeric value
* **Email List Growth**: Developing social strategies that make growing our email list a priority and that promote our list in ongoing social media campaigns.
* **Setting Channel-Specific Goals and Guidelines**: What works on Instagram might not work on Pinterest. Create a channel-specific strategy and best practices guidelines for Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and LinkedIn.
* **Research**: Researching and staying up to speed on new social media marketing strategies and how we can use them to add value to our audience.
* **Determine Important KPIs**: Determine what measurements will be tracked to help us see what works and what doesn’t work, and how our social efforts are leading to more leads and sales.

EXECUTION

* **Campaign Creation**: Partner with our content and marketing team to help support our product launches on the social front. You’ll do this by designing and executing results-driven, lead-generating, and high-converting social media campaigns.
* **Social Media Brand Management**: Act as the brand voice for Your Virtual Upline across all social media platforms by developing and executing a regular posting strategy, including creating and/or repurposing engaging content that establishes our presence as an authority
* **Create Content Calendars**: Create a strategic and organized content calendar that ties into our paid promotions, free community, podcast episodes, etc.
* **Copywriting**: Follow the guidelines of our in-depth brand voice guide and write social copy that matches our voice and feels relatable and informal.

COMMUNITY

* **Community Management**: Owning community engagement and responding to customers who voice their feedback, questions, or complaints on social media channels. You’ll do this *(with the help from our internal team)* by posting engaging content, soliciting relationships, initiating discussion, monitoring comments, answering questions, being highly responsive, and elevating any concerns or arising themes to our customer experience team.

ANALYSIS

* **Weekly Reporting**: creating streamlined, easy to digest, high-level reports detailing top posts, follower growth, campaign success and any other important metrics the marketing team should know about.
* **Tracking and Reporting Analytics**: Constantly tracking and reporting on social analytics and metrics, making suggestions for improvement based on your findings in these reports.
* **Monitoring Community**: Gathering important feedback and insights from our communities on social and sharing with the team in addition to tweaking content strategy to match what our community is asking for and/or in need of.

**Skills, Abilities and Experience**

You are a strong fit for this position if the statements below are true for you:

* Social media is your passion. You can easily spot an effective social media channel and identify the qualities that make it successful.
* You are constantly paying attention to what is working for leading brands and can visualize how it can apply to our brand.
* You embrace a get it done mindset, and bring a positive attitude to all situations
* You are a thinker and a doer. This position is a mix of both. You can come up with strong, smart strategies and you also don’t hesitate to jump in and implement them.
* You understand the power of a good story and you are a master at asking the right questions of the right people to bring that story to life.
* You're an effective communicator, especially in writing. Your grammar and writing skills are top-notch.
* You are committed to continuous learning and growth. Refining your skills and becoming a better version of yourself is part of who you are
* You are a rockstar at communicating with a team, and organizing a team around specific tasks
* You love measuring and tracking the success of your campaigns and growth endeavors. You rely on analytics to give you insight into what’s working and what’s not.

**Salary**: $70,000 – $75,000 based on experience

**Extra perks + details**:

* **Competitive Pay and Bonus Potential** - You will have the ability to earn bonuses tied to the overall performance of the business, and your contribution to those results.
* **Flexible Work Schedule** – This is a work from home / anywhere position. As long as you have a working internet, you can take this job anywhere!
* **Flexible Time Off and Sick Leave** – We believe that working hard and taking full ownership of your role shouldn’t come at the expense of lifestyle freedom.
* **Paid Holidays** – including a Thanksgiving Break and Holiday Break!
* **Birthday Leave** – Never working on your birthday again. Hit the beach or the spa, we don’t care what you do, just don’t come to work!
* **Bonus Potential** – Hard work and smashing goals don’t go unnoticed or unrewarded here at our company. We can share the details when we speak.
* **Learning Opportunities** – A mastermind, summit, or learning experience that will enrich your knowledge in your particular role? It’s on us!

**Application Instructions**

If you believe you are a qualified candidate, submit your application, and someone from our team will be in touch if we think you might be fit!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Hotel Area Sales Manager- Economy Brands
description:
**About Gillis**



At Gillis, we believe that sales is the lifeblood for all organizations. Our mission is to make sales accessible and achievable to all hotel owners. We also believe that our associates are our biggest asset and we put our people first over profit. If you are looking for a company that invests in its culture in a fast-paced, supportive, and dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you.

  



Our clients trust us to increase their revenue and build both short-term and long-term business. We embrace the dynamic nature of our industry and always ask ourselves, “How can this be done better?” and “How can we provide more value?”.

 **Overview**


* The G6 Area Sales Manager (ASM) will be part of the G6 Hospitality Portfolio and will provide strategic, outbound and proactive sales for 10 specific economy branded hotels, including but not limited to Motel 6 and Studio 6 hotels within the USA.
* This position is home-based and reports to the National Director of Sales for the G6 portfolio.

  


**What’s in it for you?**


* Position is home-based (remote) during client’s business hours and requires occasional travel for in-market visits.
* Working within a fun and fast-paced environment, Gillis’ culture offers dynamic training, ongoing coaching, and a deep commitment to taking care of our employees.
* Competitive salary (range: $55,000 to $60,000), quarterly incentives and an annual profit-sharing bonus.
* 15 accrued PTO days per year plus one 3-day weekend each month in recognition of holidays.
* Comprehensive benefits package.
* Team offsites.

  


**Responsibilities**


* **Provide strategic, outbound and proactive sales for a portfolio of 10 specific economy-branded hotels** while also creating a sales-focused culture with the General Managers and Front Desk staff by sharing best practices and peer to peer coaching.
* **Accountable for driving ROI for hotel partners** while achieving revenue milestones on a shortened sales cycle of 6 months.
* **Activate new accounts** **in the local market and increase market share from existing accounts**, with a focus on the blue and grey-collar segments, through intentional and strategic prospecting. Deliver monthly sales strategy presentations over MS Teams with each of your designated hotels to report progress.
* **Participate in the onboarding of portfolio hotels** and ensure hotels are leveraging the brand’s resources and programs.
* **Develop and nurture a sales pipeline** **utilizing Salesforce CRM** to manage accounts and shorten the sales cycle.
* **Support the Dynamic Sales Solution model** by working closely with your assigned POD (team) to drive revenue across our portfolio of hotels.
* **Create remarkable client experiences**, manage client expectations, and maintain a high level of client satisfaction by acting as a seamless extension of the hotel and representing your clients with professionalism and integrity.
* **Ability to travel for occasional in-market visits** to elevate and strengthen client relationships with Hotel Owners, General Managers, and team which will expand sales targets and increase revenue.

  


**Requirements**


**Hotel Industry Sales Experience:**


* 3 or more consecutive years of hotel guestroom sales experience in business transient, crew, and government segments within a select service or economy hotel.
* 2 years of experience in a Dual or Area hotel sales role is preferred.
* Strong understanding of hotel systems and brand tools.
* Understands how to communicate and negotiate effectively so that prospecting efforts are converted into actualized revenue.
* Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets in the economy sector.
* Ability to establish and maintain relationships with hotel clients and team members.
* General hotel operations knowledge.


**Technical Proficiency:**


* Proven experience using a CRM system to manage your sales pipeline and be held accountable for daily activities and follow-ups to track progress within your sales cycle.
* Strong ability to use all Microsoft Office applications (ie. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint) to effectively manage your portfolio of hotels by creating and analyzing reports, delivering presentations, and presenting progress updates.
* Ability to work remotely from your home-office at a computer for extended periods of time.


**Other Skills:**


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills to create and deliver general correspondence, proposals, and reports.
* Strong organization, time management, and adaptability skills are essential.
* A collaborative team player who is goal-oriented, eager to contribute and learn from others, while seeking continuous improvement.
* Applicant can reside anywhere in the USA.

  


**Employee Experience**



Don’t take our word for it! Read below what some of our colleagues value about working at Gillis:

  

“I find it remarkable that our company takes pride in doing the right thing, for the sold pleasure of doing the right thing. Integrity, professionalism, and freedom to spread our wings. I cannot think of a better working environment.”

  



“The company makes an extra effort to make sure that their staff is well taken care of mentally and financially.”

  



“I love the opportunity for growth and advancement, the flexibility to work from home, generous paid vacation, good benefits. Great leadership and a team culture.”

title: Director, Brand Demand & Communications
description:
***"Seeking a visionary Director of Brand Demand to steer Absorb software into uncharted territories of growth and innovation. If you're passionate about transforming Learning, possess a knack for building compelling messaging and communications, and thrive in a dynamic environment that celebrates creativity and results, we want you. Let's shape the future of learning together."*** **Saravana Sivanandham, CMO**


Join Absorb Software as the Director of Brand Demand and Communications, where you'll spearhead strategies to elevate our brand presence and drive meaningful engagement. As a seasoned marketing leader, you'll craft and implement comprehensive communications plans aligned with our GTM strategies. Your role will be pivotal in enhancing brand awareness, nurturing leads, and optimizing our marketing channels for maximum impact. If you're a proactive, results-driven individual with a passion for innovation and collaboration, this is the perfect opportunity to make your mark in the dynamic world of SaaS.


Absorb Culture - Absorb LMS


**What you’ll do:**


* Build and execute strategies to increase brand demand.
* Develop communications strategies and program plans aligned with Absorb’s overall GTM and business goals across critical communications, positioning, and messaging.
* Create a brand marketing and public relations strategy that will allow Absorb to cultivate and enhance meaningful awareness with targeted, high-level external audiences.
* Responsible for influencer marketing – Identify and onboard influencers who can improve brand awareness and participate in the referral program.
* Provide strategic counsel, guidance, and execution for digital marketing, lead generation, nurturing, sales enablement, trade show activities, etc.
* Manages various marketing channels, including contributing to digital strategy and contributing new ideas to enhance the team’s social media presence.
* Pioneer on industry best practices and emerging strategies that will ensure a competitive edge in brand awareness, consumer acquisition, and retention.
* Monitors marketing projects, analyzes results, and liaises with other leaders in marketing.


**What you’ll bring:**


* 5-7 years of focused B2B brand marketing and PR experience with SaaS companies
* Willingness to move fast, roll up your sleeves to support your team, and be open to testing and implementing new ways of doing things.
* Experience in demand generation marketing tactics and strategies in addition to having vast experience in digital marketing channels and tactics inclusive of display advertising, SEM/SEO, social media, email, and so forth.
* Ability to make data-driven decisions, deal with ambiguity and show a deep interest and comfort in working with ROI and metric-driven models.
* Exceptional leadership skills, being able to move and inspire a cross-functional group, leading it into a unified direction and with a common vision
* Possess superior communication skills and must be display comfort interacting with senior executives and external business partners
* Self-starter who will demonstrate resourcefulness to get answers
* Able to juggle multiple projects simultaneously and execute flawlessly
* Incredibly organized and detail-oriented
* Great communicator – written and verbal


**Are you ready to become an Absorber?**

**What we offer:**

* Fully remote-first work with flexible work arrangements
* Comprehensive Health and Wellness Benefits including retirement savings programs, eligibility for two different bonus plans, generous time off, comprehensive medical and dental benefits based on your country of location
* New Hire Equipment Allowance and monthly Flex Allowance to support your success
* Endless opportunity for career growth and internal mobility
* Employee driven DE&I programs
* Games room, meditation & yoga space, state of the art workplace for Absorbers in our Calgary office


**Who are we?**


Absorb Software is a remote-first company that provides online training solutions to leading organizations around the world. Absorb is a cloud-based learning management system (LMS) engineered to inspire learning and fuel business productivity. Our online learning platform combines forward-thinking technology built to scale as our customer’s organizations grow. We empower learners to enrich their lives, workplaces and communities.


**Our values are simple:**


* **We achieve exceptional results by genuinely caring about each other and the work we do**
* **We’re united, and we grow through our commitment to elevating continual learning!**


Absorb is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment for all our people. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. In the event a current Absorb employee would like to apply for this role they will inform their supervisor prior to submitting their application. Successful candidates for this position will be subject to pre-employment background screening, including a criminal record check and must be able to show proof of legal eligibility to work in the country they have applied to without sponsorship.


Should you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, please contact us at accessiblecareers@absorblms.com

title: E- Learning Marketing Director
description:
Accelerate Education is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Director of Marketing to lead marketing efforts across the company’s B2B and B2C channels. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a proven track record of developing and implementing successful marketing strategies that drive growth and customer engagement.

**Position Summary:**

The Director of Marketing is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the company’s marketing initiatives, including brand management, digital marketing, content creation, and lead generation for Accelerate Education, Accelerate Online Academy, and select Virtual School Services customers.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies to drive customer and student acquisition, engagement, and retention across both B2B and B2C markets.
* Lead the development and implementation of multi-channel marketing campaigns, including email marketing, social media, SEO/SEM, and paid digital advertising.
* Collaborate with internal teams to develop compelling marketing collateral, including website content, blog posts, case studies, and presentations.
* Manage the company's brand identity and ensure consistency across all marketing channels.
* Generate innovative ideas and concepts for marketing campaigns, content, and branding initiatives.
* Analyze marketing metrics and KPIs to track performance and optimize campaigns for maximum effectiveness and ROI.
* Coordinate efforts with outside advertising agencies as needed.
* Other responsibilities, as assigned by manager.

**Key Capabilities:**

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Creative thinking

· Strong analytical skills

· Strong project management skills

· Digital marketing expertise

· Ability to exercise independent judgment

**Required Knowledge & Experience:**

1. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field; MBA or equivalent preferred.

2. Minimum of 8 years of experience in marketing, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.

3. Proven track record of developing and executing successful B2B and B2C marketing strategies in the education or related industry.

4. Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to drive decision-making and optimize marketing performance.

5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

6. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.

7. Experience with marketing automation platforms, CRM systems, and other marketing tools.

8. Knowledge of digital marketing techniques and best practices, including SEO, PPC, social media advertising, and email marketing.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. This person must be able to sit or stand at a personal computer for a reasonable length of time typing and reading. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**About Accelerate Education:**

Accelerate Education is a leading provider of online curriculum and blended learning solutions for elementary, middle, and high school. Accelerate is also a direct online course provider to individual students through our private Accelerate Online Academy.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $112,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Marketing: 8 years (Required)
* Leadership: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Associate Brand Manager, Salty Packtype Strategy
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA, Austin, TX but is also open to 100% remote  



  

**Summary:**


The Sr Associate Brand Manager (Sr ABM) will have primary responsibility for delivering the growth and margin plan for Salty Snacks Take Home Packtypes across SkinnyPop, Pirate’s Booty and Dot’s Pretzels. Supporting the Sr. Brand Manager, the Sr ABM will identify opportunities and lead commercialization of ideas supporting our growth and margin objectives. This role requires leading internal, cross-functional teams as well as external agencies to deliver end-to-end commercialization of projects ensuring brand objectives and financial goals are delivered.

  

  

Individuals must have strong analytical capabilities and the ability to translate analytical and market insights into clear strategies for delivering 3Y objectives. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with an emphasis on building strategy and insights as well as cross-functional collaboration and teamwork.

  


**Responsibilities:**


 Cross-Functional Collaboration & Leadership: Lead and collaborate with cross-functional team of R&D, finance, operations/supply chain, external agency partners and marketing teams to deliver Packtype led initiatives. Contribute to a culture of brand building across the broader team.


Analysis & Insights: Develop insights from analysis of market data, competitor intelligence, and consumer research to identify opportunities and risks toward delivery of packtype business objectives.


Strategy Development & Communication: Translate insights into actionable strategies to mitigate risk and drive profitable growth across the full marketing mix in order to deliver business objectives. Communicate strategies to Sr Leadership to gain alignment toward execution of key initiatives.


Project Commercialization: Lead commercialization of Packtype led projects through stage gate process, from idea to launch. Partner with agencies, cross-functional partners, and key senior stakeholders to ensure communication of project updates and changes. Demonstrate the ability to manage projects on time and in line with financial goals.


**Qualifications(Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience, etc.):**


3+ years experience in Marketing, Sales, Strategy and / or General Management


Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA or equivalent marketplace experience preferred


Self-starter with high degree of personal initiative


Strong project and timeline management skills


Ability to lead cross-functional teams


Outstanding strategic thinking and analytical abilities


Strong verbal and written communicator to wide breadth of audiences


Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving, and collaborative entrepreneurial environment

  


#LI-AM1



The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

title: Marketing Lead
description:
**Opportunity Summary:**


Ema is building the next generation AI technology to empower every employee in the enterprise to be their most creative and productive. Our proprietary tech allows enterprises to delegate most repetitive tasks to Ema, the Universal AI employee. We are founded by ex-Google, Coinbase, Okta executives, and serial entrepreneurs. We’re well-funded by the top investors and angels in the world. Ema is based in Silicon Valley with offices in Bangalore and is currently in stealth mode.

**In this role you will:**

* Strategic Planning: Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies to promote Ema, increase brand awareness, and drive customer acquisition.
* Brand Building: Establish and maintain a strong brand presence across various online and offline channels, ensuring consistency in messaging and visual identity.
* Content Creation: Create engaging and relevant content for marketing collateral, including website copy, blog posts, whitepaper, social media posts, email newsletters, and press releases.
* Digital Marketing: Manage digital marketing campaigns across platforms, and content marketing to reach target audiences and generate leads.
* Social Media Management: Oversee social media channels, including content planning, posting, engagement, and community management to foster meaningful interactions with our audience.
* Public Relations: Cultivate relationships with media outlets, influencers, and industry partners to secure press coverage, speaking opportunities, and partnerships that amplify our brand presence.
* Analytics and Optimization: Track and analyze marketing metrics and KPIs to measure the effectiveness of campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and optimize strategies for maximum impact.
* Market Research: Conduct market research and competitor analysis to understand industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape, informing marketing strategies and decision-making.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* Marketing Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in marketing roles, with a focus on digital marketing, content creation, and brand management, preferably in the technology or AI industry.
* Creativity: Strong creative skills with the ability to generate innovative ideas and develop compelling content and campaigns that resonate with target audiences.
* Digital Marketing Proficiency: Proficient in digital marketing tools and platforms, including Google Analytics, social media management tools, email marketing platforms, and content management systems.
* Analytical Skills: Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, draw actionable insights, and make data-driven decisions to optimize marketing performance and ROI.
* Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft clear and persuasive messaging tailored to different audiences and channels, especially for highly technical products.
* Project Management: Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing priorities, embrace new technologies and trends, and pivot strategies as needed to drive results and stay ahead of the curve in the dynamic AI landscape.


Join our innovative team and play a key role in shaping the marketing strategy and success of Ema. If you're passionate about marketing, driven by creativity, and excited about the potential of Generative AI, we want to hear from you!

title: Associate Brand Manager
description:

**Estimated weekly hours**: 10-20


“Wow! [Your Name Here] is the best Associate Brand Manager we’ve ever seen!”


How do you know if this is your dream work and if Fertility Bridge is your dream client? If you think you can achieve this outcome, this just might be the place for you:

title: Director of Brand Management
description:
**Who is Basemakers?**

At Basemakers, we help brands increase their sales velocity where it matters most: at the shelf, and have the vision to become a one-stop sales shop for emerging brands in the food and beverage world, creating world-class brands. Partnering with natural and specialty brands in the consumer packaged goods (CPG) industry, we operate nation-wide helping increase the visibility of brands at a store level. However, our success reaches its highest levels when we embrace our why: we believe in the power of relationships to change the world for the better. Our approach sets us apart as not simply a retail, sales, and merchandising company but a true partner with brands, with communities, and with individuals looking to make a difference—including you!

**Be a Basemaker**

Our Basemakers are committed to living our core values:

* *P - We* ***PURSUE EXCELLENCE***
* *I - We act with* ***INTEGRITY***
* *T - We choose* ***TEAMWORK***
* *C - We* ***COMMUNICATE WELL***
* *H - We bring* ***HEART***

**The Opportunity**

Basemakers is on the hunt for a visionary Director of Brand Management to helm our Brand Partner Management on our our Elite, INC 500 team! This role is crafted for a leader who not only embodies our core values but also drives brand partnership management to new heights. As that leader, you will take charge of brand retention and expansion, uplift our customer service standards, and leverage analytics for actionable insights while directly managing our top brand partners. You are a strategic thinker with a passion for excellence, innovation, and personalization. Your opportunity will be to lead the strategic direction for our new brokerage division, enhance our Salesforce CRM with advanced dashboards and tracking, and cultivate a tailored onboarding experience for every brand partner (the Basemakers way!).

**Key Responsibilities**

* Forge and execute robust strategies for brand retention, expansion, and the direct oversight of top brand partners, ensuring alignment with our strategic goals.
* Provide leadership and mentorship to our team of Brand Partner Managers, promoting a culture of excellence, innovation, and ongoing enhancement.
* Collaborate closely with the Brand Partner Manager Team Lead on vital initiatives, team development, and operational excellence.
* Deepen relationships with brand partners, securing their satisfaction and loyalty through proactive outreach and effective problem resolution.
* Seek out and exploit opportunities for revenue growth via strategic partnerships, innovative expansion efforts, and penetrating new markets.
* Set a new benchmark for customer service by ensuring brand partners’ expectations are not only met but surpassed, focusing on a seamless onboarding experience.
* Refine our use of Salesforce CRM by developing top-tier dashboards and tracking mechanisms, providing comprehensive insights into brand partner dynamics and market trends.
* Serve as the main conduit between brand partners, our field team, and various company departments, facilitating a unified approach to achieving shared goals.
* Direct the account management strategy for our burgeoning brokerage division, working in concert with the executive team on route to market planning and detailed sales strategy development.
* Propel the Brand Partner Management department's data and analytics capabilities forward, offering our brand partners unparalleled reporting and data-driven insights.

**Qualifications**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field; a Master’s degree is preferred.
* Demonstrated success in brand management, partnership management, or similar roles, particularly in leadership capacities.
* Exceptional skills in interpersonal communication, negotiation, and conflict resolution.
* Strong analytical prowess and proficiency in CRM software, especially Salesforce, with a proven track record in dashboard and tracking enhancements.
* A comprehensive understanding of market dynamics, customer relationship management, and strategic planning, with a knack for designing customized onboarding experiences and sales strategies.

**Benefits You'll Enjoy**

* Health Reimbursement Arrangement, dental, and vision insurance.
* 401k plan with 15% employer match of contributions, up to 5% of total compensation.
* Frontloaded PTO.
* Monthly cell phone reimbursement.
* 8 paid holidays.
* Monthly stipends to recognize and be recognized by others.
* Company events: quarterly get-togethers, annual all-company meetings.

We are looking for a strategic thinker with a passion for excellence, innovation, and personalization. If you aspire to lead our brand management efforts and drive our brand partnerships and brokerage division towards unparalleled success, Basemakers invites you to apply!

#LI-JH1

Pay: From $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Remote

title: Brand Manager
description:

Location: Fully Remote

Company Overview: Channel Key is a fast-growing Las Vegas tech enabled eCommerce Agency that helps brands and manufacturers maximize their revenue, profit, and brand control on Amazon. We are fully remote! We are looking for talented individuals that are growth-minded and want to work in a fast-paced remote work environment serving amazing consumer brands.

We are seeking dedicated team members that can embody our passion for delivering top-level service. For this role, the individual must possess the candor to have effective conversations; have excellent analytic and organizational skills; be motivated, detail-oriented, and a great multi-tasker; and have the ability to work independently in a demanding and ever-changing environment. This is the nature of eCommerce!

Channel Key has built a culture upon 6 KEY values:

Own Everything  
Positivity Is a Choice
