title: Senior Manager, Brand and Marketing
description:
Overview:

Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.  

We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment. **We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members.** ***"Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”*** **Our benefits include:**  

* Medical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one!
* Virtual Medical Services
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one)
* Paid parental leave
* Company paid life insurance
* Vacation time to enjoy getting away
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Plus, more!


Growth opportunities available! **Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!** **Summary of Position:**  

As a Senior Manager or Brand and Marketing, you will develop integrated marketing strategies, campaigns, measurement and analytics. Plan and execute business, association and retail campaigns. You will be considered a steward for the brand and drive compliance across the organization.
Responsibilities:
**Brand*** Drive brand stewardship across the organization – externally building brand as leader in industry and internally strengthening the culture
* Ensure alignment of brand positioning across businesses – govern the brand
* Liaison and drive alignment with global brand team
* Develop and deliver external brand communications strategies to strengthen and protect the brand promise, develop our culture and support business growth
* Association and retail support, planning and execution (creative, imagery,, copy content, etc.)

**Planning and Strategy*** Develop detailed understanding of the C&I and R&LC business, including, strategic objectives, competitors, customer audiences and journeys and value propositions
* Draft annual marketing plan reflective objectives and performance goals, identifying needs, channels, and opportunities, driving customer loyalty, generating revenue and promoting leadership, awareness and value for KINA
* Apply marketing tactics, messaging, and actions to appropriate stages of the buying funnel for our customer segments
* Identify industry trends and opportunities for innovation that align with the business’s objectives and company’s financial goals
* Promote our value proposition and work to expand brand recognition and awareness of KINA with identified target audiences and markets

**Leadership*** Understand the business performance, objectives and roadmap to contribute to business planning at the executive level, and translate to a marketing strategy
* Participate in regular business reviews with sales leadership and ensure the alignment of the marketing plans to objectives, performance results and goals
* Leverage data and analytics to measure campaigns, create dashboard and ROI
* Host quarterly Marketing Reviews with internal teams and business leadership providing campaign analysis, state of marketing, opportunities and forecasts

**Communication and Teamwork*** Establish and communicate campaign targets, objectives, and goals and set performance expectations aligned with capabilities and budget
* Work cross functionally within marketing and customer experience team as well as with sales, customer service, sustainability, innovation and operations teams
* Liaise with the internal marketing teams and field sales to ensure they understand marketing objectives, have awareness of marketing campaigns, access to marketing resources, and follow marketing standards and policies.
* Cultivate relationships and serve as point of contact with agency partners
* Develop performance metrics and reporting to optimize agency partner performance and ensure marketing program and campaign goals, benchmarks and customer objectives are achieved
* Prioritize workload and goals for direct reports, monitor performance and provide ongoing feedback in alignment with annual performance goals
* Foster healthy relationships while working in a matrixed organization to drive alignment
* Remain flexible and agile while working through multiple projects/priorities


Qualifications:
**Education**:* Bachelors Degree in Marketing or related field

**Experience:*** 10+ years’ experience in retail/channel marketing, ideally in the design/home industry or consumer / retail marketing strongly preferred

  

It is the policy of Knauf Insulation to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic prohibited by applicable law.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Social Current is a dynamic, inclusive, multifaceted network of human and social services organizations, leveraging the collective experience of the field and research, and sparking a current in the sector to propel continuous evolution and improvement. Social Current is grounded in our values to be unifying, intrepid, just, and purposeful in all that we do. We will advocate for and implement equitable solutions to the most challenging issues facing our sector and, more broadly, to society. By creating a space for collaboration, innovation, policy, and practice excellence, we will lift up the voices of communities and community-based organizations to drive systemic change, influence federal policy, and ignite the change needed to create an equitable society where all people thrive. Our work will support the social sector who is responsible for responding to the vital needs in their communities.  

  

**Position Summary**  

The Digital Marketing Manager is responsible for contributing to and assisting in the development, implementation, and execution of the Social Current’s strategic marketing plan so that the organization can achieve its business goals. This role designs and implements the organization’s social media strategy, including creating original text and multimedia content, managing posts, and responding to followers.
  

  

In addition, the Digital Marketing Manager consults with internal teams around their goals and marketing objectives to guide the development and execution of marketing and communication plans that include digital and social media, email and content marketing, and graphic design. In collaboration with the marketing and communications specialist, the Digital Media and Brand Manager creates images, one-pagers, and other items using graphic design software.  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities*** Assist in developing and executing creative, innovative, and varied marketing campaigns using organic and paid social media, email communications, website, SEO, SEM etc.
* Design and implement social media strategy to align with business goals.
* Develop and manage budgets for related marketing and digital media initiatives.
* Implement and review campaign tracking parameters and reporting metrics to support continuous improvement.
* Write and edit marketing materials (blog posts and articles, promotional emails, product and service brochures, PowerPoint presentations, etc.) for use in integrated marketing campaigns.
* Create images, one-pagers, and other items using graphic design software.
* Support the implementation of the organization’s brand identity and ensure brand consistency throughout the organization by providing templates, guides, and instruction to staff.
* Consult on communication efforts with key Social Current executives.
* Participate in organization’s thought leadership strategy by authoring articles, presenting webinars or workshops, or facilitating conversations among the organization’s stakeholders.

**Education and Experience*** Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in marketing/communications, journalism, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of previous digital, social media, and graphic design experience; familiarity or experience in the nonprofit sector and/or public policy and advocacy a plus.
* A writing sample will be required as part of the final interview process.

**Qualifications and Expectations**  

  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* Proven work experience as a social media manager.
* Advanced knowledge of social media analytics and reporting as well as major content management system software.
* Skills and experience in writing and editing for diverse audiences and communications channels.
* Strong knowledge of SEO, SEM, and GA4.
* NetBase/Quid experience a significant plus.
* Strong experience with WordPress website management and email marketing software.
* Knowledge and experience with Adobe Creative Cloud and Canva.
* Project management skills and the ability to execute complex projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience working with vendors, including printers and suppliers.
* Advanced knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and Outlook).
* Familiarity with customer relationship management software, Salesforce a plus, as well as SharePoint, and project management software.

**Individual Contributor Competencies**  

**Achievement Focus – Drive for Results:**  

Persists to complete tasks and responsibilities. Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles. Recognizes and acts on opportunities. Sets and achieves challenging goals.
  

  

**Quality:**  

Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness. Looks for ways to improve and promote quality. Monitors own work to ensure quality. Applies feedback to improve performance.  

  

**Initiative:**  

Looks for and takes advantage of opportunities. Seeks increased responsibilities. Takes independent actions and calculated risks. Asks for help when needed.  

  

**Personal Accountability:**  

Holds self-accountable for achieving results/goals, honoring commitments, and meeting deadlines.  

  

**Learning Agility:**  

Learns quickly from all types of situations and can adapt behavior to new situations to improve performance. Takes risks in applying new ideas/thinking/approaches.  

**The EDI Statement-Individual Contributor:**  

* Demonstrates an understanding and commitment to Social Current’s equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI) values statement.
* Is able to articulate one’s own commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as it relates to their role at Social Current and beyond.
* Demonstrates a willingness to examine one’s own biases, assumptions, and attitudes.
* Engages in personal and professional development on issues related to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
* Promotes a respectful, diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment in which concerns are addressed effectively.

**Travel Expectations:**
------------------------


Travel is expected; approximately 7 days per year to support in-person events and attend staff meetings.  

  

**Salary and Benefits:**  

  

This exempt position will offer an annual salary based upon standard work hours of 35 hours per week. This position will pay an annual salary commensurate to the market, salary range will be $52,000 to $63,700. In addition, Social Current offers a generous paid time off plan (PTO), medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits to include a 401k retirement plan.
**About This Job Description**  

The information provided in this job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job classification and level of responsibilities. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position. Social Current is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants for employment to a position represented by this job description will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Manager, Brand Design
description:
**Who we are**



Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.



Working at Samsara means you'll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that's shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you'll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term.


**Recent awards we've won include:**



Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2024



Best Places to Work by Built In 2024



Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023



Fast Company's Best Workplaces for Innovators 2023



Financial Times The Americas' Fastest Growing Companies 2023



We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey.

**About the role:**



We are looking for a motivated, highly creative, and strategic design leader who is passionate about pushing the boundaries of design to rise above the mundane. Working within Marketing and reporting to the Creative Director, you'll join our amazing team of designers, strategists, producers, filmmakers, and copywriters. In this role, you'll manage, mentor, and inspire a team of brand designers to help elevate and evolve the way we communicate our brand to the world.



You will manage a defined set of brand design objectives and outcomes. You will oversee the planning and execution of a myriad of design projects from stakeholders across the organization. You will serve as a Samsara brand guardian to maintain consistency with every project to ensure alignment with our brand guidelines and design best practices. Initiatives include projects ranging in scope, media channel, and audience, from digital, like social media and web, to print, like trade show booths and OOH advertising campaigns. The ideal candidate is obsessed with design excellence and stresses the details, is a passionate leader, and an effective communicator across all levels of the organization.



This role is open to candidates residing in the US except Alaska, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Texas, Virginia, Washington DC, and Washington.


**You should apply if:**


* **You want to impact the industries that run our world:** Your efforts will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
* **You are the architect of your own career:** If you put in the work, this role won't be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment.
* **You're energized by our opportunity:** The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
* **You want to be with the best:** At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-caliber team that will encourage you to do your best.


*Click here* *to learn about what we value at Samsara.*

#### **In this role, you will:**


* Work closely with the Creative Director and other creative leaders on conceptual development, design and execution across key marketing briefs
* Manage, mentor, and inspire brand designers to execute strategy/roadmap
* Partner with creative and cross-functional teams to diagnose, recommend, and deliver effective design solutions
* Solve standard and complex design problems and requirements
* Spearhead and/or collaborate with a variety of vendors depending on the project
* Have a clear understanding of project briefs and the ability to craft thoughtful design solutions
* Articulate and present ideas clearly and concisely; accept constructive feedback and execute against it efficiently
* Ensure the consistency of the brand and highest quality of design across all projects
* Have a natural curiosity and passion to learn about and share insights on design and industry trends
* Work on problems of diverse scope where evaluation of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors
* Demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
* Network with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise
* Oversee the interview and hiring process for design talent
* Champion, role model, and embed Samsara's cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices
* Hire, develop and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team


**Minimum requirements for the role:**


* 6+ years experience in art direction and design in a creative agency or client-side group; B2B / tech experience is a plus
* BA/BFA in Art, Design, a related field or equivalent experience required
* Proficient in Google Slides, Keynote, PowerPoint, InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Figma, Social Media designs (Paid + Organic Ads) and creation of Zoom backgrounds
* Extraordinary design skills; top-notch portfolio of work
* Strong understanding of page layout and graphic design principles
* Strong storyteller (understands how messaging and visuals work together)
* Knowledge of the production process; ability to collaborate with 3rd party vendors
* Ability to design soft goods (shirts, hats, bags) and large-scale items for events (stages, window clings, banners)
* Strong communication presentation skills; proven ability to present to executives/leaders
* Solid knowledge of all aspects of creative across channels and mediums, especially print and digital


**An ideal candidate also has:**


* An inspiring, positive, force of nature who is always bringing new ideas to the table
* Passionate for design and keen to take on new challenges to further professional development
* Someone who has strong interpersonal & communication skills and a collaborative approach
* Able to be adaptable and able to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* A positive attitude and are eager to learn

**Samsara's Compensation Philosophy**: Samsara's compensation program is designed to deliver Total Direct Compensation (based on role, level, and geography) that is at or above market. We do this through our base salary + bonus/variable + restricted stock unit awards (RSUs) for eligible roles. For eligible roles, a new hire RSU award may be awarded at the time of hire, and additional RSU refresh grants may be awarded annually.



We pay for performance, and top performers in eligible roles may receive above-market equity refresh awards which allow employees to achieve higher market positioning.

**The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.**


$104,720—$140,800 USD
At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, and other characteristics protected by law. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.


**Benefits**



Full time employees receive a competitive total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.


**Accommodations**



Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or **click here**if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.


**Flexible Working**



At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they're based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual's ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company.

  



Please be aware that Samsara does not accept or assume responsibility for unsolicited resumes from agencies. We do not charge fees to applicants at any stage of the hiring process. Official communication about your application will only come from emails ending in '@Samsara.com' or '@us-greenhouse-mail.io'.

title: Director, Brand Strategy & Social
description:
**LVLWNG IS** a company that is passionate about doing work that creates emotional and remarkable responses. Our team members are in the constant pursuit of lifelong learning and insight and truly love the craft of advertising. We believe in the power of relationships, and we love to take initiative to create meaningful action that positively impacts the businesses of our amazing clients. We also believe that success in this business starts with strong and differentiated brands. This is where you enter our story.

**Position Summary:** Levelwing is seeking an innovative, Director-level, thinker to lead our social, content and brand strategy initiatives and help drive our integrated content development. As a strategist, you will uncover consumer insights to develop differentiated brand positioning and messaging. You will then work with our internal social and content teams to translate strategy into engaging creative campaigns and content across platforms.

**Minimum Skills & Requirements:**

* Must have eight plus (8+) years of brand strategy experience; agency experience strongly preferred
* Must have a track record of developing insights-driven brand positions and compelling creative campaigns
* Must have a deep passion for brand strategy & social media
* Must have proven frameworks that help inform strategic direction
* Most posses excellent creative ideation and storytelling skills
* Must posses strong leadership, collaboration, and communication skills
* Must have an analytical mindset and data-driven approach
* Must posses a passion for understanding consumers and brands
* Must posses the agility to adapt in a fast-paced environment

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Leading brand strategy initiatives including research, analysis, and brand positioning development
* Translating brand strategy into integrated creative & social media strategies, as well as broader content campaigns
* Overseeing social teams to develop on-brand, engaging content across advertising channels (social, digital, video, etc.)
* Collaborating cross-functionally to ensure brand consistency across customer touchpoints
* Continuously optimizing content and messaging for engagement and conversion throughout customer journey
* Leveraging analytics to derive insights and improve brand strategy and performance
* Staying ahead of trends in brand messaging, social media consumption and creative content development
* Leading and managing a team of social media strategists and managers, providing guidance, feedback, and mentorship to ensure high-quality deliverables

**Locations:** Levelwing is committed to providing our employees with work environments that suit their lifestyles, as a result we operate as a remote and hybrid agency with office locations in Charleston, South Carolina and Nashville, Tennessee.

**Important Note:** At Levelwing we are committed to providing excellent service to our clients. Although Levelwing is a remote and hybrid agency, to best support our clients continuously evolving campaigns, all Levelwing employees must be in either eastern or central time zones. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply to any of our open positions.

**Disclaimer:** The above job description is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position and in no way is to be construed as a contract. As with all positions, employment is “at will” or voluntary on both the part of the organization and the team member. Employment is not for a set period of time and may be discontinued by either party for any reason with or without notice.

*Levelwing is an equal opportunity employer. If some of the requirements above are an "Unsure" or "Kind of!" for you, please still apply. We celebrate diversity of person and thought, and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Senior Brand Manager
description:
Position Title:
Senior Brand Manager
Salary Range:
$84,500.73 - $118,301.02
Job Description Summary:
This position will plan and execute marketing and communications strategies to support our mission and programs. This position will assume substantial delegation authority from Marketing leadership to lead all aspects of the strategy for specified areas, including the effective utilization of outsourced talent as necessary to achieve organizational goals. Primary responsibilities of this position include creating and executing strategies for brand management and revenue generation, maintaining a favorable public image, organizational communication, and effective promotion of all Sourcewell services.
Job Description:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
1. Brand Management* Assists in developing and ensuring brand and identity standards, including image and messaging throughout all Sourcewell-produced materials and attended events.
* Effectively develops and implements brand strategies to drive revenue and client engagement and loyalty, including media advertising and promotional activities such as print, online, electronic media, and direct mail.
* Conducts thorough market research to identify customer needs, preferences, and trends to inform brand strategy.
* Analyzes and reports on brand and campaign performance, including developing and managing key performance indicators (KPIs)to track and measure engagement and ROI.


2. Leads strategy and implementation of marketing strategy within assigned vertical/audience* Develops and implements marketing strategy to support assigned vertical(s) growth and revenue objectives, including media advertising and promotional activities such as print, online, electronic media, and direct mail.
* Leads cross-functional teams to develop new strategies and execute plans for revenue-generation and growth.
* Initiates and supports the execution of targeted marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including social media, email, and web.
* Enterprises and facilitates content development for assigned vertical and approves editorial and advertorial content.
* Oversees management of communication strategy through social media, Power Points, flyers, video, audio, banners and other selected mediums.
* Manages external agencies and vendors to ensure timely and on-budge delivery of all brand-related initiatives.
* Stays current with industry trends and best practices in brand management, marketing, and digital media.
* Assists with messaging and tracking of all marketing, communication, and public relations related collateral.
* Helps oversee studio productions, video and audio editing and content library.
* Develops and manages the brand focus area annual marketing budget and ensures marketing initiatives are within budget and aligned with organizational objectives.


3. Assists with team strategic planning* Works collaboratively with team members and other departments to align marketing, communication, and public relations strategies with departmental and organization goals.
* Assists in Researches Sourcewell’s marketing needs and assists in developing overall organizational marketing plan to include development of brand focus area specific marketing plans.
* Effectively conducts thorough research and effectively utilizes research and market intelligence to ensure marketing, communication, and public relations strategies are aligned with achieving organizational goals.
* Analyzes and recommends improvements and alternatives to execute the team’s plans and strategies.


4. Provides marketing and public relations team business management* Helps evaluate the department’s information and asset management systems, management procedures, and internal controls to ensure quality and efficiency.
* In collaboration with Marketing team leadership, assists in the development and implementation of best practices in marketing partnerships, use of data to aim campaigns, assuring continuity in messaging and branding across all mediums, and continuous improvement of processes and procedures for marketing projects and materials.
* Assists in monitoring department processes and procedures, along with implementation and efficient use of department workflow tools.


5. Partners with Marketing team to provide input, guidance, and development* Collaborates with digital team to ensure website content is current, consistent with messaging and brand, accessible, and maximizes user experience.
* Collaborates with social media and communication team to ensure alignment with organizational objectives and provide content and campaign materials with execution schedules.
* Provides team support for Sourcewell events as defined in vertical strategy or requested.


6. Other duties as assigned
Additional Job Description:
Required Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, public relations, or communications *AND* a minimum of seven (7) years demonstrated industry experience *OR*
* A combination or related post-secondary and/or professional education/training and demonstrated relevant work experience equivalent to a total of eleven (11) years.
* Two or more (2+) years of demonstrated experience with brand management
* Two or more (2+) years of experience developing and implementing a marketing plan, organizational communication strategy and/or public relations strategy
* Experience in media buying and segment specific tactics
* Website and social media experience
* Two or more (2+) years of Experience in strategic planning Proficient in the use of Adobe Creative Suite


Preferred Qualifications* Master’s degree in marketing, public relations, or communications
* Nine or more (9+) years demonstrated industry experience
* Two (2) or more years’ experience leading people or teams


Position open until filled.
Salary Range:* Grade 12, $84,500.73 - $118,301.02 per fiscal year, commensurate with experience.


First review of applications will take place March 21st. If interested, please submit your application prior to this date to be considered.
Location:* This is a remote position, and is subject to Sourcewell's telecommuting policies and procedures.
* On occasion may be expected to attend meetings or trainings at Sourcewell's headquarters in Staples, MN, advance notice would be given to team member.

*\\*Sourcewell is currently accepting applications from all states, except the following: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont, and Washington. Applicants living in or planning to relocate to a state not on this list are encouraged to apply. \\***Sourcewell exists to empower community success. We stand with our partners in government and education striving to recognize and honor the differences in each of our community members. We are committed to removing barriers to equity.**Values** *Seek.* *Be curious.*
* *Empower.* *Be accountable and liberate others.*
* *Impact.* *Be a difference maker*


Full Time/Part Time:
Full time
Position Type:
Regular
Scheduled Hours:
40#LI-Remote

title: Advanced Writer and Brand Manager for Ad and Marketing Agency
description:
Select Advisors Institute is one of the nation's top marketing and branding agencies for the financial industry.

We have been featured in Barron's, the Wall Street Journal, InvestmentNews and many many more publications.

Our current network of wealth management and financial firms is over $30 billion under management.

We are seeking a highly advanced writer, brand consultant and marketing coordinator. The right candidate will also need to eventually get on Zoom meetings with clients in order to develop content by interviewing them.

You need to be **super tech savvy** and have the communication skills and responsiveness needed for a remote role (*ie. 5 hour gaps between responding will not work*). This is a great fit for someone who replies quickly, has a VERY flexible schedule, isn't looking for a traditional 9-5 role with benefits, but a more entrepreneurial role with **major major upside** in their career and learning.

If you have the skills needed for writing highly eloquent captions, blogs, and updating and refreshing websites and marketing collateral, please apply!

A PhD or advanced writing degree will be highly desirable. This is a part-time, contract role, so a great fit for someone not looking for something full time;.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $45.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* On call

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* On a scale of 1 to 10, 1 being slow to adopt 10 very much so, how would you rank yourself in being tech-savvy? If we give you a new app to operate, we need you to be able to be super fast in understanding how to use it.
* How many hours are you looking to work? What happens if we don't give you enough work? How are you making an income now or in the future? We ask because we can not guarantee hours for this role.
* Let's test your writing skills: How would you summarize this lesson for a sophisticated reader: Got a job offer? Don't make a decision yet. Wait for 24 hours and think over it. Don't be impulsive! This is a big deal choice.

Got fired? Wait for 24 hours and think what happened and what is your next best step. Don't rush to call the next recruiter that pops up on your job search

* What metaphor and imagery (stock photos, illustrations) comes to mind visually for you when you think of a financial company has all its services integrated (estate planning with investing with tax) for the benefit of the client?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Communication skills: 5 years (Preferred)
* Branding: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior eCommerce Brand Manager
description:
Neato is a full service Commerce Accelerator that helps major retail brands sell better on marketplaces. We make money by collaborating with brands as their exclusive retail partner on Amazon and in-turn provide a comprehensive suite of agency services at no cost. Our core competencies are marketplace management, marketing, advertising, distribution, brand control, and multimedia creative production all aimed toward quantifiable growth of marketplace sales channels. As a top 500 storefront on Amazon we help brands tame the hardest to control sales channels on the internet. As a data driven company, Neato finds solutions through analysis of consumer and market trends to mitigate risk to our partnered brands.

  

Neato is a well capitalized late stage start-up. We were recently ranked 39th Fastest Growing Company in America by Inc. Magazine and we are eager to grow our team with like-minded leaders looking to make a large impact in a rapidly growing industry.

 **The Opportunity**

  



We are seeking an experienced, forward-thinking Sr. Brand Manager with a strong background in eCommerce strategy to act as the team lead and main point of contact for our brand partners. This individual will be responsible for creating and implementing strategies to drive the growth of our partners' presence and sales on the marketplace. As the liaison between departments and the de facto project manager for all projects related to the brands they manage, the Sr. Brand Manager will play a critical role in revolutionizing our partners' digital presence. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in all things digital, with a proven track record of growing major brands on digital platforms.

  


**Responsibilities**

  

* Serve as the main point of contact for brand partners, fostering strong relationships and ensuring clear communication of goals and progress.
* Identify opportunities in the marketplace using gap analysis, product and category research and competitive analysis, and develop growth initiatives and merchandising strategies including go-to-market, product optimization and rationalization, and expansion, focusing on sales conversion and visibility.
* Collaborate with internal teams to develop and implement marketing, creative, and advertising initiatives, and supply chain to ensure product availability to support brand partners' objectives.
* Analyze market and competitive data, trends, and performance metrics to inform strategic decision-making and optimize results.
* Monitor and report on brand performance, providing actionable insights and recommendations for improvement.
* Stay current on eCommerce best practices, emerging technologies, and industry trends, incorporating innovative ideas and approaches into strategies.
* Act as a liaison between departments, facilitating collaboration and ensuring efficient project management for all initiatives related to the brands.
* Mentor and support junior team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous learning, and growth.

  


**Qualifications**

  

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field; advanced degree is a plus.
* 7+ years of experience in eCommerce, digital marketing, or brand management, with a focus on driving growth for **major brands**.
* Demonstrated success in independently managing all facets of eCommerce for a brand with minimal reliance on external agencies.
* Proven track record of success in developing and implementing data-driven eCommerce strategies.
* Exceptional communication, presentation, and relationship-building skills, with the ability to engage and inspire stakeholders at all levels and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Strong analytical mindset, with experience in leveraging data and identifying actionable insights to inform strategy and optimize performance.
* Comprehensive understanding of the digital landscape, including Amazon and other eCommerce platforms, marketing channels, and emerging technologies.
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to evaluate operational gaps and weaknesses and develop scalable solutions to drive business growth and market share.

  


**What We Offer**

  

* A unique opportunity to join a fast-growing, innovative company and make a lasting impact on our success
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and vision insurance, and unlimited (and encouraged) PTO
* A vibrant, collaborative work environment with a strong company culture and commitment to employee growth and development.

  



Are you ready to shape the future of Neato? Apply now and join us on this exciting journey!

 *The Neato Company is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Commercial Marketing Manager
description:
**Company & Culture:**

At GT's Living Foods, LLC, we've stayed true to the authentic brewing process for over 25 years. Our #1 selling Kombucha is raw, organic, naturally effervescent, and handcrafted in small batches – always cultured, never compromised. We're proud to remain a family-owned & operated company. As our GT's family continues to grow, we are deeply humbled and sincerely grateful for every moment of this journey with you.

  


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or related field (required)
* 6-8 years of customer/commercial marketing, commercialization, or related experience
* Experience in CPG, Food & Beverage (natural & conventional grocers, mass-market retailers)
* Experience with syndicated data (ie: SPINs, Nielsen, IRI) and category management
* Must have proven track record in leading/growing commercial marketing and sales
* Able to travel up to 20% to support trade events, customer calls, etc.
* Interest and passion for raw foods and kombucha

  


**Job Responsibilities:**

As the Commercial Marketing Manager, you will lead customer marketing and sales initiatives aimed at achieving business objectives. Your role involves devising and implementing comprehensive commercial and customer marketing strategies to reinforce the company's and brands' leadership in their respective categories. This entails close collaboration with cross-functional teams to develop and execute marketing campaigns that effectively reach and engage target audiences. Your responsibilities also include analyzing market dynamics, competitor activities, and consumer insights to drive strategic decision-making and enhance marketing effectiveness. You will oversee market analysis, competitive landscape assessment, and identify growth opportunities both within and beyond the current product portfolio. Moreover, you will spearhead the creation and upkeep of sales resources, consumer education plans, and play a pivotal role in launching new products to market.

  


**Essential Duties:**


* Lead Life Cycle Management and Stage Gate processes for innovation, ensuring timely product launches aligned with sales and marketing goals.
* Oversee the creation of compelling marketing collateral to support commercial initiatives, including sales materials and presentations.
* Align sales guidance with marketing efforts, supporting lead generation and conversion while championing a customer-centric approach.
* Collaborate with marketing analysts and channel partners to optimize marketing effectiveness through test and learn agendas and best practices.
* Participate in developing and executing comprehensive go-to-market plans for launches and current product lines.
* Devise and execute internal and external marketing communications strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Implement and evaluate competitive and commercial account marketing plans, tailoring strategies to specific accounts and priorities.
* Oversee the execution of Commercial Marketing Plans in collaboration with Omnichannel Marketing, Shopper Marketing Managers, Brand Marketing, Insights, and Sales teams.
* Collaborate with Sales and Retail teams to achieve key commercial objectives beyond campaign concepts.
* Serve as the primary commercial driver for the Account marketing team, identifying growth opportunities and recommending category-level business opportunities.
* Provide support in Account planning and integrate commercial drivers into sell-in presentations, including seasonal sell-in meetings and business reviews.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence by providing leadership and mentorship to the sales and marketing team.

  


**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**


* Possess expertise in marketing strategy, encompassing life cycle management, stage gate processes, and go-to-market planning.
* Demonstrate a highly analytical and strategic mindset, coupled with a customer-oriented approach and extensive experience in commercial marketing and category management, to identify pivotal avenues for brand growth.
* Utilize advanced market and sales analysis skills to scrutinize market trends, competitive dynamics, and customer insights.
* Align marketing strategies with sales objectives across diverse product lines, ensuring a comprehensive commercial strategy across various channels and accounts.
* Customize marketing initiatives to effectively address customer needs, prioritizing a customer-centric approach.
* Foster collaboration with cross-functional teams to integrate marketing and sales efforts seamlessly.
* Implement brand positioning and messaging strategies to enhance brand management and resonance.
* Exhibit proficiency in project management, including planning, executing, and evaluating marketing campaigns, particularly for retailer meetings.
* Provide leadership and mentorship to nurture a culture of collaboration and excellence across cross functional teams.
* Possess strong writing and presentation skills, adept at presenting information analytically and simplifying complex business inquiries.


**Job Details:**


* Work Hours: Monday through Friday, business hours; Remote/Hybrid
* Work Attire: Use good judgment, keeping in mind the nature of their work, their safety and the safety of others, and their need to interact with the public.
* Pay Range: $90,000 - $130,000

  

*GT's Living Foods, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and maintaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other basis protected under federal, state or local laws.*

title: Online Community Manager for New Toy Brand
description:
**About Us:**

Jilly Bing is the company behind The Jilly Doll, the first of many dolls and characters to come celebrating Asian heritage. Jilly Bing’s mission is to reflect the many faces of Asian American children. We strive to be a trusted resource for adults as they teach children about cultural acceptance as well as Asian foods, holidays, and languages.

We launched in August 2023 and have been featured on the Today show, SF Chronicle, NBC, CBS and more for our vision of building an authentic Asian American toy brand.

Our culture combines a commitment to creating superior products for our children and parents, and a hustle startup mentality. We have a strong sense of urgency. We're excited for you to join us on this exhilarating journey as we embark on our second year of growth with more products and resources.

**About You:**  
We are seeking a dynamic and enthusiastic Online Community Manager to join our fast growing team and help grow our children's toy brand through active participation in various online communities and management of our social media channels.

You will be the primary point of contact for engaging with our audience, moderating discussions, and fostering a positive and interactive online community environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Engage in Mom & parenting online groups, forums, and communities to represent our brand.
* Manage social media comments, ensuring positive brand image and timely responses.
* Foster engaging conversations aligned with our brand values.
* Act as a liaison, addressing inquiries and concerns with professionalism.
* Collaborate with teams to gather insights for marketing and product development.
* Act as the face and voice of our brand, embodying our values and maintaining consistency in communication across all channels.
* Additional marketing supports as needed (email, content, etc)

**Ideal Candidate Qualifications:**

* Strong communication skills to craft engaging content.
* Excellent customer service skills for effective issue resolution.
* Proven experience in community or social media management, preferably in children's products.
* Familiarity with social media platforms and management tools.
* Genuine interest in children's products with a desire to make a positive impact.
* Remote: 5-10 hours per week
* Experience working with or knowledge of Parenting and/or Asian American community is a plus

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $19.32 - $28.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 10 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Do you participate in parenting/Mom online communities?

Experience:

* Post-College Working: 10 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Content Marketing Manager

**Classification:** Full-Time, Exempt, At-Will

**Reports to:** Director of Marketing

**Department:** Sales and Marketing

**Location:** Remote

 **Race Communications is only accepting remote candidates who reside in the following states: California, Colorado, Arizona, Oregon, Hawaii, Florida and Oklahoma. If you do not reside in one of these states, you are not eligible for remote employment.**

 **Location Status:** Work will be primarily performed remotely from home office. Employee will be required to utilize personal phone and internet services to perform telecommuting with reimbursement according to applicable procedures. Occasional travel to and work from other Race offices or off-site locations may be required.

 **About Us:**


Race Communications is one of California’s leading telecommunications and fiber technology companies, offering a full range of communications services and competing in over 25 markets with investments totaling **$150M** in recent years.


Working in partnership with several public and private entities, Race focuses its efforts on building top-tier networks that service small businesses and Fortune 500 companies alike.


Our comprehensive network has brought significant improvements to local entities, education, community services, and public safety across the state.


In today's connected world, reliable, high-speed internet is an absolute necessity, and it is our company's **mission** to provide advanced communications at an affordable price. Race focuses its efforts towards building world-class fiber networks and offering gigabit internet service to communities throughout California.

 **Summary:**


The Content Marketing Manager will be responsible for leading the content marketing team, developing, and executing comprehensive brand and content strategies to enhance our brand identity, engage our target audience, and drive business growth. This role requires a combination of strategic thinking, creativity, and strong communication skills to effectively deliver consistent brand messages and engaging content across various channels.


The Content Marketing Manager exercises significant independent judgement, problem solving, and discretion in the development and implementation of marketing systems with minimal direct supervision. This individual should be able to communicate and work effectively with external service representatives and internal team members who possess a wide variety of backgrounds, personalities, and communication skills. This individual should be able to work effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced, and evolving environment while effectively managing and motivating team members. This individual must be capable of working independently, as well as collaboratively with other Race team members across teams and levels of our organization.

 **Qualifications and Experience:**

  

* Eligibility for US Employment without sponsorship
* Minimum of 18 years of age
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field experience
* Proven experience 7+ in brand management, content marketing, or a similar role
* Strong expertise in content strategy, creation, and distribution across various channels
* Strong understanding and proficiency in SEO and google analytics
* Demonstrates exceptional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt the tone and style for different audiences
* Demonstratable proficiency in email marketing platforms, content management systems (CMS), and presentation tools (e.g., PowerPoint, Keynote)
* Proven visual design skills with a keen eye for aesthetics and attention to detail
* Demonstratable project management skills with a track record of running multiple projects and meet deadlines
* Demonstratable experience with editing and proofing both video and editorial content
* Familiarity with digital marketing analytics and reporting tools to measure the impact of brand and content marketing efforts
* The ability to effectively communicate in English, including speaking, reading, writing, and comprehension, as necessary for effective job performance and workplace communication

 **Skills:**

* Creative thinker with the ability to translate complex ideas into compelling, easy-to-understand content
* Proficient use of MS Office applications including Teams, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; teleconferencing applications
* Functional use of common office equipment, computers, and office software
* Strong time management skills, with the ability to manage priorities and workflow
* Commitment to accuracy and high standards for quality of work
* Ability to work with all levels of team members and management
* Excellent problem resolution and customer service skills
* Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all organizational levels
* Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to work on complex projects with general direction and minimal guidance
* Versatility, flexibility, and willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with a sense of urgency
* Good judgement with the ability to make timely and sound decisions
* Highly resourceful team-player, with the ability to also be extremely effective independently
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

  

Day-to-day Responsibilities:

* Reviews and edits content for social media posts, blogs, white papers, website landing pages and other media
* Meets with content team members to track progress, assess workload capacity, ensure adherence to editorial calendar deadlines, and makes adjustments to workflows as necessary
* Collaborates with colleagues in marketing, product, sales, and other departments to uphold consistent style and branding guidelines
* Analyzes content performance metrics and refining content strategy accordingly


Supervision and Leadership:

* Supervise and lead the content marketing team to produce high-quality content aligned with the company’s marketing goals and brand voice
* Provide guidance, mentorship, and feedback to team members to help them grown and develop their skills
* Set clear objectives and goals for the content team, and track progress towards achieving them
* Stays up-to-date with industry trends, best practices and emerging technologies in content marketing and share insights and recommendations with the team
* Represents the content team in cross-functional meetings, presentations, and discussions with senior leadership
* Fosters a collaborative and creative work environment that encourages innovation, experimentation, and continuous improvement


Develop and Execute Content Strategy:

  

* Serves as content editor for blogs, articles, websites, emails, webinars, social media and other formats to ensure continuity in tone and voice throughout the brand
* Develops, implements, and executes content strategy that drive engagement, traffic, and conversations across various channels, including website, social media, email, and more
* Research content performance, customer behavior data and competitors’ strategies
* Analyzes performance metrics and KPI’s to measure effectiveness of content initiatives and make data-driven decision to optimize results
* Enforces style guidelines, deadlines, and budgets for content teams
* Manages content calendars, editorial schedules, and workflows to ensure timely delivery of content projects
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure content aligns with overall business objectives and messaging
* Works with other departments, marketers, writers, editors, and freelancers to support overall company goals and objectives

  

Brand Visuals:

* Oversees the development and maintenance of brand visuals, including graphics, imagery, videos, and other multimedia assets
* Collaborates with design teams or agencies to create visually compelling and consistent brand materials across various channels and touchpoints
* Ensures brand visuals reflect our brand identity, values, and resonate with our target audience

  

Other duties as necessary may include but are not limited to:

* Successfully completes assigned training and examinations, as well as participate in ongoing performance and development reviews, and goal setting
* Be available to participate in internal or external meetings, special functions, and professional development opportunities
* Cross-trains and shares knowledge with other team members
* Supports routine tasks
* Maintains a professional appearance, hygiene, and demeanor
* Performs other related duties as assigned by management


Supervisory Responsibilities:

  

* Direct supervision and support to employees regarding content marketing related issues across various practices within the department, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and relevant laws and regulations
* Supervisory responsibilities include direct supervision of subordinates, along with interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems
* Liaise with other departments and act as a management point of contact for the Content Marketing Team
* Collaborates with team members, other departmental managers, and senior management

 **As Part of Our Team, You'll Enjoy:**

* 100% premium paid for medical, dental, vision and life for all our employees!
* An excellent 401 (k) with 100% Employer-matched up to 4%
* Working to bridge the digital divide between rural and urban areas, providing much needed services to those who don't have access to reliable internet
* Working for a company that appreciates their employees; every member of the Race team is a part of a collaborative family

  

All offers of employment are contingent until all pre-employment requirements are met. These requirements, which vary by position, may include drug and background screenings as well as Motor Vehicle and DOT related screening and reporting requirements. Race will consider qualified job applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.

  

All new employees will participate in the mandatory 'Speedway to Success' (Speedway) orientation at one our offices located in either Tehachapi, CA, Yuba City, CA, or South San Francisco, CA. The duration of the Speedway program spans from 1-3 weeks, depending on the position. During Speedway the schedule will vary: 8-hour days are planned, but shorter days may occur depending on the group’s pace. Applicants further than 50 miles from these training locations will be provided with necessary travel accommodations as part of the onboarding process. Applicants 50 miles or less from these locations will be considered regular commute. For those working remotely, virtual attendance will depend on position requirements. Further details will be provided to you during the interview process, and before your start date.

  

Race Communications is an equal opportunity employer who welcomes applications from individuals (with or without reasonable accommodation), with the skills, experience, and dedication to excel in their roles without regard to race, religion, color, sex/gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sex stereotype, gender identity/gender expression and sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information/characteristics, marital status/registered domestic partner status, age, sexual orientation, reproductive health decision-making, military or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

  

Reasonable accommodation(s) for qualified individuals with disabilities are available as part of the application and interview processes. If accommodations are needed during the application or interview process, or workplace accommodations are required after a job offer is made, please contact hr@race.com to initiate the interactive process.

title: Brand Manager
description:
The **Brand Manager** is a key member of the Robert Half Brand team. Our goal as a team is to protect and help grow Robert Half and build brand equity, preference, and loyalty. Leading with strategic thinking, insights, and data, the Brand Team will deliver a cohesive brand experience globally with an ear to our audiences’ needs and wants and an eye to positioning ourselves uniquely and boldly across all communication touchpoints and experiences.


A Brand Manager’s work will range from amorphous strategic projects to writing a company-wide guideline. This person needs to have experience in brand strategy, brand marketing, and cross-functional marketing. Bring your expertise and experience from other categories as we welcome different schools of thought and ways to help amplify the Robert Half brand.


Those who will be successful in this role exhibit the following qualities: self-starter; inquisitive; comfortable with ambiguity; ambitious; enthusiastic; strong attention to detail. On a regular basis, you will need to think strategically, provide recommendations, and justify branding efforts with data and audience insights. We are looking for a strategic thinker, not just a person who can execute. Success doesn’t solely entail solving present challenges – it involved anticipating future ones. At Robert Half, your success will also heavily rely on your ability to collaborate well with others and has a strong emotional quotient. This role will include opportunities to present to senior leadership, so strong presentation skills and effective PowerPoint presentations are a must.

**Scope of work and responsibilities may include:**

* Managing a variety of audience-facing brand marketing projects: Creating brand guidelines ( from naming to brand merchandise), positioning and messaging frameworks for out business lines, , and strategy documents such as brand architecture and messaging frameworks for key practices; Assisting in our brand advertising campaign – briefing and feedback on the creation of assets such as audio/video/display and being able to collaborate with the media team and its channel recommendations.
* A champion for our brand purpose and promise, as well as the customer experience. This includes leading discussions with Sr. leadership and cross-functional teams across the organization [internal corporate and field stakeholders] to ensure we are leveraging our brand platform/strategy appropriately and consistently to meet business objectives.
* Identifying new ways of amplifying our brand and troubleshooting gaps that currently exist with how our brand is represented across all touchpoints.
* Defining and creating brand processes to be leveraged with crossfunctional teams.
* Developing and enhancing a “brand education” program on the company Intranet which ensures that all employees understand the brand guidelines and standards, and that they have access to the appropriate logos and branded tools.
* Strong understanding of the customer and our various audiences and segments.
* Optimizing how we track the health of our brand.
* Partnering/communicating and collaborating effectively with graphic/web designers, art directors, sales enablement, events/alliances, and social media managers, to ensure the brand message is communicated effectively and creatively.
* Managing an agency/vendor whether it be a strategy agency, creative agency or research agency.
* Educating outside vendors on the brand and our business, as needed, to ensure that all agencies we work with produce work that is on brand and aligned to our business goals. In addition, is responsible for demanding creative (visual or messaging) excellence from our agencies and assisting in drafting agency briefs, as necessary.

**Additional Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications or a related field ideally within a Fortune 500 or ecommerce firm; full-time MBA graduate preferred.
* 7+ years of brand and marketing experience; media advertising and insights background a plus.
* Insights-driven and data-minded with a strong understanding of brand, consumer, and product marketing.
* Excellent PowerPoint skills – clear and concise decks are a must as well as being able to create visually effective decks is a must. Fluency in Excel is preferred.
* Experienced in B2B marketing and/or professional services is a plus
* Familiarity with Google Analytics, SharePoint, Domo, and Salesforce, a plus.
* Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) to communicate to senior leadership.


The typical annual salary range for this position is shown below and is negotiable depending upon experience and location. The position is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus.


$93,000.00 - $136,000.00
We offer exceptional earning potential and a competitive benefits package, including group health insurance benefits (medical, vision, dental), FSA and HSA healthcare accounts, life and accident insurance, adoption and fertility assistance, paid parental leave of up to 6 weeks, and short/long term disability. Robert Half provides paid time off for vacation, personal needs, and sick time. The amount of Choice Time Off (CTO) our people receive varies based on their years of service and is pro-rated based on the hours worked per week. A new hire earns up to 17 days of CTO per calendar year. Our people also receive up to 11 paid holidays per calendar year. We also offer the opportunity to contribute to our company 401(k) savings and investment plan or deferred compensation plan (if eligible), with an employer match of 100% on the first 3% of your contributions for eligible employees. Learn more at roberthalfbenefits.com/Resources.


Robert Half Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veteran


As part of Robert Half’s Corporate Services facility employment process, any offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background check.


Robert Half is committed to being an equal employment employer offering opportunities to all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to HRSolutions@roberthalf.com or call 1.855.744.6947 for assistance.


In your email please include the following:

* The specific accommodation requested to complete the employment application.
* The location(s) (city, state) to which you would like to apply.

title: Senior Manager, Digital Diagnostics & Corporate Marketing
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------



PathAI is on a mission to improve patient outcomes with AI-powered pathology. We are transforming traditional pathology methods into powerful, new technologies. These innovations in pathology can help accelerate drug development, improve confidence in the accuracy of diagnosis, and get life-saving therapies to patients more quickly. At PathAI, you'll work with a diverse and talented team of people, who are dedicated to solving complex problems and making a huge impact.


**Where You Fit**
-----------------



The Senior Manager, Digital Diagnostics & Corporate Marketing will have a hybrid role supporting Product Marketing for our Digital Diagnostics business, providing software and AI solutions to pathology labs, as well as our overall Corporate Marketing efforts. The ideal candidate is someone who has product marketing and/or product management experience, and is comfortable in the clinical and research spaces.This role will report directly to the Chief Growth Officer and have high visibility across the organization.


**What You'll Do**
------------------


#### **Digital Diagnostics - Product Marketing**


* Create launch plans for new Digital Diagnostics customer-facing product(s) or service(s) in partnership with Digital Diagnostics Product and Commercial teams including target customer identification, key messages, go-to-market plan, and market growth pathways
* Create PathAI's marketing and communication strategy for Digital Diagnostics-related industry conferences and external communications, in partnership with relevant stakeholders
* Develop sales pitch collateral for the Digital Diagnostics Commercial team to secure new business and/or maintain pipeline of projects with existing customers
* Track and summarize key competitive activities, implications, and recommendations
* Design and execute market research or customer research projects to uncover unmet needs, whitespace, or new perceptions to inform marketing strategies and executions; includes management of PathAI pathologist advisory board members
* Drive marketing channel selection, investment, and digital metrics reporting in partnership with internal stakeholders
* Identify and manage creative agencies on creative and content development, from brief creation to project management, to output/deliverables
* Identify opportunities to achieve sales targets through marketing tactics

#### **Corporate Marketing**


* Understand the research and technologies that PathAI offers and the value proposition across customer segments with an ability to articulate easily to those with a basic level of understanding
* Craft corporate messaging that resonates with our prospects, customers, and partners across business lines (including employees!)
* Periodically refresh PathAI's brand strategy and partner with internal stakeholders on the optimization and expansion of brand standards
* Serve as steward of brand guidelines and strategy as it is executed in other areas of the business (diagnostic marketing, product marketing, recruitment, etc.) and with third-party partners
* Plan and execute on press releases and media engagement, as well as marketing campaigns across multiple channels, in partnership with third-party partners
* Write, manage, and edit copy for internal collaborators for a variety of content needs such as website, collateral, campaigns, internal/external communications, and more

**What You Bring**
------------------


* Bachelor's degree
* Significant experience in product marketing with experience in brand management in the healthcare field; or MBA with 4+ years of experience in product marketing and/or brand management in the healthcare field
* Strategic agility that allows you to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop engaging content that will attract customers regardless of segment/business line
* Strong writing skills; able distill complex ideas into easy to communicate language
* An eye for design based on extensive experience creating collateral and/or communications tools that are visual in nature
* Strong communication skills and the ability to have a confident presence with internal and external stakeholders
* The ability to manage multiple projects and work streams independently
* An insatiable intellectual curiosity and the ability to learn quickly in a complex space
* Experience with presenting recommendations and strategies to senior-level management.
* Experience developing value proposition, brand/product positioning and messaging
* Experience creating design content or guiding the creation of design content
* Business acumen with experience in obtaining market insights, analyzing qualitative and quantitative data, and synthesize key findings
* Strong desire and demonstrated experience with cross-functional communication and internal stakeholder management
* Experience working with and/or managing agencies (or internal creative teams) in integrated communications, including brief development, evaluation of creative, and copy development


* **Bonus Points:**


	+ Experience in launching a SaaS, pharmaceutical, or a med device product or platform
	+ Experience in pharmaceuticals, medical devices, or biotech
	+ Experience working at a hyper-growth stage company (Series A-C)

**We Want To Hear From You**
----------------------------



At PathAI, we are looking for individuals who are team players, are willing to do the work no matter how big or small it may be, and who are passionate about everything they do. If this sounds like you, even if you may not match the job description to a tee, we encourage you to apply. You could be exactly what we're looking for.



PathAI is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace that is free of harassment and discrimination. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and qualifications — that's all. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, health, personal beliefs, age, family or parental status, or any other status. We don't tolerate any kind of discrimination or bias, and we are looking for teammates who feel the same way.
