* Handle monthly bills in the office (rent, internet, phone, etc.).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 - $48,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Payment frequency:

* Paid weekly

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* What event related skills do you possess?

Experience:

* Event planning: 2 years (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Brand Manager
description:
**About NSTXL**  
The National Security Technology Accelerator (NSTXL) harvests innovative technology from the commercial and non-defense marketplace, ensuring the development of better, cheaper, and faster defense capabilities. We offer a unique and simplified approach to rapidly develop, demonstrate, and assess prototypes that address a range of operational and installation needs, from individual Warfighter technology up to large-scale installation projects. NSTXL delivers technology to the Warfighter by serving as a one-stop shop to match government requirements with innovative private-sector and academic solutions.

Each of our OTAs is a distinct member-based not-for-profit with its own membership that is managed and serviced by NSTXL. Currently, our OTAs have more than 900 corporate, non-profit, educational, and financial institution members. For these members, NSTXL offers opportunities to bid on government contracts, education and training, and live/virtual forums on a wide variety of topics.

\\*  
Job Description\\*  
The Brand Manager is responsible for the creating and managing NSTXL’s brand story and experience through compelling content and conversion-based strategy. You will play a pivotal role in developing and executing strategies to enhance the overall image and recognition of our primary and owned brands. This role will be responsible for ensuring that the brand remains cohesive, resonates with the target audience, and aligns with the company's objectives. This position requires a combination of creative thinking, strategic planning, and effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement comprehensive brand strategies to strengthen brand presence, conducting market research to understand consumer trends, competitor activities, and industry dynamics to inform brand strategy.
* Support Directors and Customers, collaborate with internal and external partners, to execute brand initiatives such as advertising agencies and vendors.
* Manage and mentor the Creative team.
* Track and evaluate brand performance metrics, providing regular reports and insights to the leadership team.
* Create and oversee the creation of content designed to raise target market awareness: videos, press, website, blogs, guides, customer stories, landing pages, market emails, social, etc.
* Develop comprehensive brand positioning strategies and toolkits for products and services, creating and optimizing new campaigns to support awareness of offerings and internal knowledge of services.
* Manage Editorial Calendar across all owned channels including blog, websites, social media, YouTube, and print media.
* Own website content, updates, and experience, implementing SEO best practices and identifying opportunities to increase new visitor traffic.
* Optimize NSTXL and other owned websites for conversions, creating new website pages and campaigns to support conversion goals.
* Ensure that anything leaving the marketing department, both self-generated and created by others, fully adheres to all brand standards.
* Work w/ Program and Event Teams for Creative strategy and execution for program collateral, PowerPoint, content development.

Manage assigned budget while making recommendations to best optimize spend to accomplish goal.  
\\*

**Location:**

Remote  
\\*  
Required Qualifications:\\*

* US citizen and ability to get security clearance.
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in brand, content, or digital marketing.
* 2+ years experience managing a team of 2 or more

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Ability to both create content and build a comprehensive content strategy.
* Excellent planning, organizational and problem-solving skills to successfully coordinate multiple programs and adapt to unexpected requests.
* Team player with a passion for creating moving, story-driven content that converts.
* Understanding of new media, traditional media, and emerging media with experience working across multiple mediums and channels.
* Enthusiasm for our mission and vision
* Knowledge of marketing automation, CRM and CMS, such as HubSpot or Sprout
* Understanding of social media platforms, from a creative and operational perspective
* Experience Adobe Design Suite and with Canva
* Deep understanding of SEO and how to optimize digital content.
* Project management experience and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Possess strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Must have excellent planning, organizational, and problem-solving skills.

**Travel:**

* Travel for this position is estimated at 20%

\\*  
What We Offer\\*  
The National Security Technology Accelerator (NSTXL) harvests innovative technology from the commercial and non-defense marketplace, ensuring the development of better, cheaper, and faster defense capabilities. We offer a unique and simplified approach to rapidly develop, demonstrate, and assess prototypes that address a range of operational and installation needs, from individual Warfighter technology up to large-scale installation projects. NSTXL delivers technology to the Warfighter by serving as a one-stop shop to match government requirements with innovative private-sector and academic solutions.  
We strive to be one of the best places to work in America. We offer competitive salaries and benefits, including flexible work hours, paid sick leave, work-from-home accommodations, a 401(k)-profit-sharing plan, a wellness plan, floating holidays, and much more.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Chief Marketing and Communications Officer
description:
Description:

The American Immigration Council (the Council) works to strengthen America by shaping how the nation thinks about and acts towards immigrants and immigration and by working toward a more fair and just immigration system that opens its doors to those in need of protection and unleashes the energy and skills that immigrants bring.

**Position Summar**y


The Council is looking for a creative leader that will develop a consistent and compelling message to a broad set of stakeholders that will expand the reach of the Council’s work, elevate the Council’s brand, and help define the Council’s place within the immigration landscape. An ideal candidate is creative, resourceful, can create with limited resources, can quickly build meaningful relationships with others and must be an initiative-taker. This role requires a seasoned marketing, brand, and communications leader, with strong management skills and the ability to forge new relationships with key organizations and brands with strong distribution channels.


Candidates should have experience leading strategy and narrative development in fast-paced, collaborative, entrepreneurial, and inclusive environments, alongside community-based field organizing and/or community development. Further, they will also bring a depth of experience fostering community connection and civic trust, and crafting and executing integrated marketing communications strategies and campaigns. Demonstrated skill in translating the Council’s priorities and core issues to broader target audiences and stakeholders and experience with partnerships and/or business development are a must have skill.


They will be responsible for strengthening and bringing greater visibility to the Council’s brand to enhance the fulfillment of its mission, increase supporter engagement, support fundraising, and, critically important, further its brand recognition. An important part of this role will be partnering with the Managing Director, Strategy and Programs to lift the work of the program departments, while simultaneously supporting and advancing the development of the Council’s narrative and culture change strategies to strengthen narrative power. The candidate will be expected to forge new relationships with organizations and brands with national reach.


The candidate will develop and execute a comprehensive strategic communications plan for the organization, including traditional and digital communications, media relations, marketing, branding, public relations, and the Council’s overall public engagement. They will work with the Chief Development Officer to develop and coordinate effective and consistent messaging between the Communication and Content and Consumer Brand Departments and the Council’s development and fundraising efforts.


This role is a member of the Council’s executive team and reports to the Executive Director. As with all positions at the Council, this position requires commitment to the Council’s mission, the organization’s culture of philanthropy, and to becoming a place where diverse viewpoints and experiences are encouraged and listened to, and where every individual is given an opportunity to thrive.

**Responsibilities Include:**

* Develop and execute clearly defined marketing strategies in support of stated financial and mission-critical goals while advancing the Council’s brand.
* Lead and manage integrated communications strategy development and execution, aligned with the Council’s newly identified strategic priorities, programmatic work, policy positions, audience data, and best practices, messaging lessons, and emerging insights across a broad and diverse field.
* Develop and lead outreach strategies for reputation and brand management, and elevate the Council’s presence with the media, board, donors, the public, partners, and allies.
* Streamline and implement processes that enable and expedite cross-organization collaboration, de-silo internal teams and leverage all the organizations’ talents to achieve specific strategic goals.
* Develop and maintain contacts and relationships with media, educational institutions, non-profits, corporations, and influencers to elevate the Council's mission, vision, and work.
* Raise awareness of the Council as a valuable resource, thought leader, and as a reliable and credible advocate for effective immigration policy.
* Increase the Council’s relevancy and impact by tailoring and distilling complex concepts into easy-to-digest communications materials and serve as a “translator” of policy issues for our broader target audiences and stakeholders.
* Develop metrics to assess the effectiveness and impact of communications, marketing and brand initiatives and tools.

**Strategic Business and Organizational Leadership**

* Set growth-oriented marketing goals and objectives, including building brand awareness, driving revenue, and attracting talent.
* Develop revenue growth strategies by understanding and developing business strategies, understanding target marketing, collaborating on fund development by providing the Development department competitive differentiation, market trends, and metrics.
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a talented team of Content and Brand, Center for Inclusion and Belonging, and Communications staff as well as industry or subject matter experts, with a deep commitment to the personal and professional growth of staff.
* Demonstrate high emotional intelligence and skill managing in all directions and approach others with a deep level of respect and curiosity.
* Manage a team of 10 with 3 Directors


Requirements:

Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, Psychological or cognitive sciences, or related field of study.

**Qualifications Include**:

* Experience in strategic marketing communications, marketing or public relations, and experience working in an industry or institution with similar complexities and challenges to the American Immigration Council.
* Successfully led marketing or communications campaigns
* Sales experience
* Minimum of 10+ years in a leadership role overseeing communications and marketing strategies, inclusion and belonging programs, and managing large teams.
* Deep experience with brand strategy/positioning, insight development, communications planning, integrated marketing, attitudinal and opinion research, and a proven record of success with culture change interventions.
* Demonstrated experience in areas such as brand management, direct marketing, advertising, digital marketing, consumer research, budgeting, project management, issue campaign advocacy, and/or narrative culture change strategies.


We offer a comprehensive range of benefits:

* Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits with FSA (flexible spending accounts) available immediately upon hire
* Remote Work
* Retirement plan with organization matching
* Qualifying employer for the Public Student Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF)
* Three weeks of Annual Leave. Sick Leave, and Personal Days available immediately upon hire
* 11 paid holidays per year
* Office closed between Christmas and New Year’s (paid leave offered)
* 8 weeks of paid parental leave (after one year)

***Disclaimer:***  

*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent in the position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills of the employee. Duties and responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice.*

*American Immigration Council is an at-will employer and may terminate the employment relationship at any time, for any reason, with or without cause or notice.*


The Council offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including a 401(k) with organization match; health, dental, and vision plans; life insurance; short- and long-term disability; paid time off to include company, personal, and individual holidays, vacation, sick, and parental leave.

***Equal Employment Opportunity:*** *All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.*

title: Marketing Content Manager
description:
Pioneer Valley Books (PVB) is a leading publisher of award-winning literacy resources. We are committed to providing quality books for children learning to read and resources that support teachers in their work. Our customers passionately love our products, and our company continues to grow.


*At Pioneer Valley Books, we value: Kindness | Fairness | Respect | Camaraderie | Collaboration*



We believe in the power of creativity and innovation to transform education and inspire learning. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented and experienced Content Manager to join our team and lead our creative effort.



The Content Manager will play a key role in shaping the visual identity of PVB and ensuring that our marketing materials effectively communicate our brand message. This individual will be responsible for overseeing a small team of designers and collaborating closely with the Marketing Director to drive the success of our marketing strategies. This position will oversee a team of two to four direct reports


**Key Duties**

  

**Content Creation:**

  

* Work closely with the Marketing Director to understand marketing goals and contribute creative ideas to enhance campaign effectiveness.
* Act as the bridge between marketing strategy and execution.
* Ensure content consistency across all channels. Uphold and reinforce the company's brand identity across all marketing materials, maintaining a consistent and recognizable visual style.
* Provide content direction and vision for all marketing collateral, ensuring it aligns with the company's brand guidelines and marketing objectives.
* Conceptualize and execute, through a team of designers, visually compelling designs that resonate with our target audience.
* Produce high-quality, engaging content for all platforms.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including editorial, product developers, and other stakeholders, to ensure a cohesive and integrated approach to marketing campaigns.
* Execute calendar, copy, and brand voice for social media, newsletter, client facing product descriptions, etc.
* Create, edit, and proofread content

**Team Leadership:**


* Lead and inspire a team of designers, fostering creativity and collaboration.
* Support the recruitment, onboarding, performance management, training and career development of direct supports.
* Provide constructive feedback to designers, encouraging growth and development.
* Participate in the revision process to refine and improve design work.
* Supports the Director of Marketing in the annual budgetary process in regard to various departmental needs


**SEO and Analytics:**


* Optimize content for search engines to improve organic visibility.
* Utilize analytics tools to track content performance and user engagement. Build and adjust strategies based on these key performance indicators.
* Make data-driven decisions to enhance content strategy.


**Brand Management:**


* Uphold and reinforce brand identity and messaging in all content.
* Collaborate with marketing and design teams to maintain brand consistency.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Edit and proofread content for accuracy and brand voice


**Qualifications/Experience**



Our ideal candidate will possess the following qualities:


* Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* 5-8 Years of Experience in a Marketing capacity with some people management experience.
* Proven experience as a Content Manager or similar role.
* Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a keen attention to detail.
* In-depth knowledge of content marketing principles and SEO best practices.
* Proficiency in content management systems (CMS) and analytics tools.
* Excellent organizational and project management skills.
* Strong portfolio showcasing creative and innovative design work.
* Knowledge of literacy programs and educational initiatives is advantageous.
* Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills.
* Experience in educational publishing or a related field is a plus.


**Attributes**:


* Creativity and a passion for storytelling.
* Excellent organizational and project management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively and adapt in a dynamic environment.
* Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
* Stay updated on industry trends and emerging content strategies.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, from concept to completion, ensuring that deadlines are met and deliverables are of the highest quality


Our company office is located in Northampton, MA. We offer a competitive compensation package, with a discretionary bonus opportunity, a competitive benefits package, and a small, welcoming, pet-friendly office environment. Benefits offered include:


* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
* Paid Family and Medical Leave
* Generous paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays and floating holidays
* 401(k) and profit sharing plans
* Alternative work schedules
* Remote/Hybrid options for most positions


At PVB, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome, valued, and respected. We believe that diversity of thought, experience, and background is essential to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, or any other protected status.



We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. We believe that diversity makes our team stronger and our company more successful. Please respond with a letter of interest and résumé. No phone calls please.



Here are some specific examples of how we promote diversity and inclusion in our workplace:


* We offer multiple DEI training opportunities to all employees.
* We have a Diversity, Inclusion, Equity, and Belonging Committee that works to create a more inclusive workplace.


We partake in regular pay analysis initiatives to ensure all our team members are compensated properly.


We hope that you will consider joining our team and helping us build a more diverse and inclusive workplace.



The deadline for this application is 03/08/2024

title: Design & Branding Manager
description:
Who We Are
  
  

Originally founded in Silicon Valley in 1952, we’ve been a private, family owned and operated business since 1969. We are humbled by the long-term relationships with our customers, earned through the packaging solutions we offer, including design, engineering, testing, manufacturing, and fulfillment of custom and stock packaging.
  
  

Your Role
  
  

Design & Branding Manager
  
  

As a Design & Branding Manager on TransPak’s Marketing team, you'll be a talented creator who puts the eyes of our customers first as you create and standardize assets on behalf of TransPak and our brand. This includes, but is not limited to, graphic design, print and digital collateral creation, video editing, and brand standardization.
  
  

\\*\\*\\*For your application to be considered, you must submit a link to a portfolio or files with examples of your work.\\*\\*\\*
  
  

What You’ll Be Doing
  
  

GRAPHIC DESIGN & ASSET PRODUCTION
  
  

Producing graphics to support marketing efforts
  
* Creating digital designs for thought leadership pieces, PR placements and pitches, social media posts, and social media profiles
* Utilizing Illustrator, InDesign, and/or Photoshop


Designing customer-facing brochures, sales sheets, and press releases
  
* Creating all print and digital collateral according to standard brand guidelines and company positioning
* Utilizing Illustrator, InDesign, and/or Photoshop
* Executing professional-quality, error-free final deliverable by agreed-upon due date


Editing video content for branded, consistent deliverables
  
* Collaborating with Content Manager to plan and edit monthly video content
* Utilizing standard intro/outro and transition templates to create branded, consistent assets


Designing new and updated web pages
  
* Consulting with internal stakeholders to draft and design pages for company website
* Ensuring web pages are optimized from a design and UX perspective; collaborate with Technical Marketing Manager to optimize design from an SEO perspective
* Actual front-end development / publish of web pages a plus


DESIGN & BRANDING-RELATED MARKETING OPERATIONS
  
  

Ensuring company-wide adherence to standard design and branding principles
  
* Maintaining up-to-date brand guidelines and asset repository
* Creating processes and platforms to encourage easy company-wide access


Developing company tradeshow strategy
  
* Identifying tradeshow opportunities and maintain long-term planning resource
* Creating standardized processes and collateral for company tradeshow exhibitions


Providing ad-hoc design support
  
* Overseeing business card design and production
* Designing, planning, and executing branded merch orders
* Producing mission-critical, customer-facing PowerPoint slides as needed


What We’d Like to See from You
  
  

**Technical skills:**  

* Web design
* Print design
* Video editing
* Management of / adherence to brand guidelines
* Front-end web development a plus
* Experience with the following tools:
* Illustrator
* InDesign
* Photoshop
* Premiere/After Effects, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve
* PowerPoint (advanced)
* WordPress a plus


**Soft skills:**  

* Attention to detail
* Timeline management
* Project management
* Organization


Your Candidacy
  
  

\\*\\*\\*For your application to be considered, you must submit a link to a portfolio or files with examples of your work.\\*\\*\\*
  
  

While we prefer candidates located in Austin, TX, or a US TransPak location, this role may be completely remote or hybrid.
  
  

Interested but Concerned You’re Not Qualified?
  
  

You may have differences in skills, education, and experience which can be applied in many ways. If you’re open to learn and grow, we’ll train you and help you be successful.

title: Brand Reputation Manager
description:
**Brand Reputation Manager** **PURE Property Management is looking for a Brand Reputation Manager! Come join our team!** **PURE Property Management offers a comprehensive package of benefits such as: Healthcare coverage, a 401K plan with a 4% percent instantly vested match, health savings accounts for eligible plans, generous vacation and sick time, dental & vision plans, life, and disability policies, an employee assistance program and more!** **Salary Range:** $73,000.00 To $78,000.00**Location:** Continental US, Remote OK, able to work a Pacific Time Zone schedule**Type:** Full-time. Suitable for individuals with a background in public relations or brand marketing.**FLSA:** Exempt**Overview**
============


As the Brand Reputation Manager, you will play a crucial role in shaping and maintaining the company's public image and reputation. Your primary focus will be on managing online reviews and directories, ensuring a positive brand presence. In addition, you will oversee the monitoring, managing, and responding to brand mentions across various media platforms. Your role includes developing strategies for reputation enhancement, crisis management, and collaborating closely with marketing teams to maintain a consistent brand message.**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

### **Online Reviews and Directories Management:**

* Manage and optimize the company’s presence on review platforms such as Google My Business, Yelp, and others.
* Develop and oversee a 5-star review program, encouraging satisfied customers to share positive experiences.
* Monitor and respond to online reviews, addressing any negative feedback in a constructive manner.
* Work with review management platforms like Experience.com, Birdeye, Reputation.com to aggregate and analyze review data.
* Collaborate with customer service and marketing teams to ensure consistency in brand messaging across review platforms.

### **Reputation Monitoring and Improvement Measurement:**

* Monitor online and offline brand mentions and analyze sentiment.
* Develop strategies for improving brand perception and handling negative mentions.
* Deploy measurement practices that demonstrate continuous improvement.
* Align reputation management strategies with overall brand marketing.

### **Crisis and Media Management:**

* Prepare and execute crisis communication plans
* Prepare and review for improvement crisis/media engagement post-mortems with key stakeholders to improve future management.
* Monitor and respond promptly, and within prescribed practices, to mitigate negative impacts on the brand.
* Ensure consistent messaging across departments during crises.

### **Content and Social Media Strategy:**

* Oversee content creation that promotes brand values and image.
* Guide social media strategies to enhance brand reputation.
* Adapt strategies based on social media trends and feedback.

### **Stakeholder Engagement:**

* Develop and deploy programs with Marketing Communications Manager that engage with new and existing clients, residents, vendors, and partners that enhance and extend our brand reputation.
* Utilize feedback cycles to inform reputation management strategies and brand improvements.

**Qualifications & Skills:**
----------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in public relations, Communications, Marketing, or related field.
* 2-5 years of experience in brand reputation management, public relations, or similar.
* Proficiency in social media platforms and monitoring tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Brandwatch, Reputation, Google My Business, Experience.com, TrustPilot, Birdeye, etc.).
* Strong analytical skills for interpreting data and sentiment analysis.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proactive and creative problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a team and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

title: Associate Brand Manager
description:
Description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**


Do you love the art, science, and creativity of social media and graphic design? Are you an advocate of international education and language learning? Love connecting audiences to brand? Then this may be the role that you have been looking for!


The Associate Brand Manager is a digitally-savvy professional with a strong background in brand, creative, traditional, and digital media marketing across the full communications ecosystem. In this key role, you will report to and collaborate with the Senior Marketing Manager to deploy integrated marketing and media campaigns, while developing content, visuals, and informing strategy. These campaigns drive brand awareness for IELTS USA, engage with our target audiences, and boost IELTS registration at US test centers and Recognition with key stakeholders throughout the U.S. market. In this role, you will find opportunities to learn and advance your skill set and feel empowered to succeed in the workplace and beyond.

**What Makes IELTS USA Special?**


IELTS USA provides information and support to organizations that use IELTS to measure the English language proficiency of international applicants. We work with US stakeholders to increase the number of institutions, programs, and organizations that use the assessment throughout the United States. We are passionate about creating pathways to secondary, post-secondary, and professional education, employment, and immigration for the international community. IELTS USA fosters an organizational culture that embraces accountability, integrity, communication, innovation, self-motivation, and a global mindset. We understand that we succeed when we work together as a team, and we work diligently to support one another to achieve both individual and organizational goals.

**Statement on Diversity and Inclusion**


As part of a global organization, IELTS USA is committed to providing a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are dedicated to fostering an environment of belonging where every individual feels seen, heard, valued, and empowered to bring their authentic self to work. We believe that by embracing our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create an organization where our employees and stakeholders can thrive and reach their full potential.


Requirements: **ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

**Marketing**

* Ability to develop a deep understanding of the IELTS market segments including test takers, ESL professionals, secondary schools, post-secondary schools, and internal teams to drive marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with IELTS USA colleagues to shape creative activities supporting B2B and B2C marketing campaigns.
* Produce a scheduled volume of creative marketing assets and content that conforms to brand guidelines, serving as an essential resource that contributes to initiatives delivered via email, newsletter, social media, in-person events, and website.
* Utilize creative storytelling techniques to convey brand messages effectively through outstanding written and verbal communication skills and engaging presentations, media, and videos.
* Work cross-departmentally with writers and content creators to refine their work, offering constructive feedback and suggestions to elevate the overall quality of end deliverables.
* Ensure the accuracy and clarity of written content by meticulously proofreading and editing documents for grammatical, spelling, and punctuation errors.
* Assist with the execution of the marketing strategy by researching, developing concepts, and creating plans that align with IELTS’ brand strategy.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and contribute innovative ideas to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness.
* Stay informed about industry trends and Google Ads and contribute to the creation and refinement of ad copy, ensuring alignment with campaign objectives and best practices for ad creation on the Google Ads platform.
* Support the development of engaging and dynamic video content tailored for various social media platforms, including but not limited to LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and more.
* Additional duties as assigned.

**Technology and Software**

* Familiarity with a wide range of design software and tools (Adobe Creative Suite and Canva preferred) including knowledge of creating to print production specifications.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, with the ability to create visually impactful presentations including multimedia elements for effective communication.
* Experience using CRMs (Salesforce experience preferred), project management tools (Trello preferred), and comprehensive marketing automation tools (Pardot preferred).
* Basic understanding of HTML & CSS and website architecture.
* Demonstrate a solid understanding of the Google Ads platform, including the ability to navigate and manage campaigns effectively.
* A basic knowledge of video editing for minor in-house & UGC projects.
* Experience using virtual meeting technology (Zoom, Teams, Google Meet).

**Teamwork and Initiative**

* Serve as a cross-functional teammate who engages, listens, and collaborates with internal teams regarding IELTS’ overall marketing and brand strategy.
* Foster a team-first approach by actively participating in team discussions, brainstorming sessions, and working on collaborative projects.
* Work seamlessly with team members to achieve collective goals, sharing ideas and supporting others in their marketing and brand-related initiatives.
* Demonstrate a proactive and results-driven attitude while working effectively in a fast-paced multi-faceted environment.

**QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE & SKILL REQUIRED**:

* Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 3 years of progressively responsible work experience in brand, creative, traditional, and digital media marketing.
* Extremely detail-oriented with exceptional writing and editing skills.
* Demonstrated ability to create verbally and visually compelling assets for social media and other platforms as demonstrated in samples of published work.
* Strong problem-solving and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects within deadlines.
* A demonstrated understanding of social platform tools and best practices across LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook,
* An ability to build relationships within the IELTS USA at all levels.
* A collaborative mindset with a high degree of drive, accountability, and initiative.
* An ability to take initiative and work independently on projects.

**KEY STAKEHOLDERS:**

* College/university Enrollment Management staff
* Secondary school admission and counseling staff
* English Language faculty
* Higher Education trade associations
* Professional programs and associations
* U.S. test centers
* U.S. test takers

**ADA SPECIFICATIONS:** (Physical demands that must be met to successfully complete the essential functions of the job)


This position is primarily sedentary with substantial domestic overnight and limited international travel. This role may require some bending and lifting.


The physical requirements of this position include, but are not limited to:

* Sedentary work: Exerting up to ten pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time.


The physical activity of this position includes but is not limited to:

* Reaching: Extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction.
* Standing: Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time.
* Walking: Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly for long distances or moving from one work site to another.
* Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.
* Hearing: Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication and making fine discriminations in sound.

title: Brand & Donor Development Director
description:
Location: Remote within the contiguous United States  

Compensation: $120k USD, 100% 401k Match, Excellent Insurance


**Job Description**
-------------------



Our mission at ISRG is to reduce financial, technological, and educational barriers to secure communication over the Internet. We operate three projects (Let’s Encrypt, Prossimo, and Divvi Up) that improve the security and privacy of billions of people using the Internet.



ISRG celebrated its 10th anniversary in 2023. During that decade, revenues have steadily grown and diversified to respond to growing needs and ambitions within our organization. We are a small team of four (soon to be five!) so we focus on efficiency, automation, and going for the big wins (for example, the lowest tier in our corporate sponsorship program is $12,500 and the highest is $500,000+). We operate as a combined comms and fundraising team because we view the two functions as symbiotic. As such, we highly value and deliver strategic, compelling, and effective communications which are the wind in the sails of our successful fundraising.



We are looking for an experienced development professional to help strengthen and diversify our funding channels. This will primarily include:



* Expand and upgrade our corporate sponsorships


* Build our earned revenue pipeline


* Prospect, cultivate and solicit contributions from high-value individual donors



We are looking for someone who is a self-starter and seeks opportunities to expand or improve our work. That means you will have the opportunity to impact other aspects of our fundraising, including communications strategy, grant strategy and writing, and revenue development for funding new ISRG projects.


**Position Must-Haves**
-----------------------


* Track record of achieving non-profit fundraising revenue targets
* Track record of cultivating and closing 6+ figure gifts
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects
* Creative thinking *and* the ability to create the systems and structure needed to make new ideas successful
* Excellent spoken and written communication skills
* Interest in technical aspects of our projects
* A mindset oriented toward efficiency and the elimination of daily “toil”
* Persistent and creative
* Openness to lend a hand to colleagues if that is the highest priority, regardless of whose responsibility it is
* Willing and able to travel


We are heavily funded by tech companies new and old. The decision-makers we work with are often a CTO, CIO or founder/CEO, so you will need to be confident in recognizing their needs, using appropriate communication styles, and developing messaging that is effective with this audience.


**Location and Benefits**
-------------------------



This is a remote position available anywhere in the contiguous United States. Travel expectations are 3-5 times per year. We will help you get your home office in good shape, including reimbursing internet and phone expenses. Other benefits include excellent health insurance, a 100% match for 401k contributions, flexible time off and generous parental leave.


**EEO Statement and Inclusive Workplace**
-----------------------------------------



Not sure if you actually meet some of our requirements? Studies have shown that female-identifying folks and people of color are less likely to be confident that they meet requirements. At ISRG we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but you’re not sure if your past experience aligns with the requirements in the job description, we encourage you to reach out to careers@abetterinternet.org.



ISRG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive workplace for everyone. It is a priority for us to represent the diversity of the billions of people who use the Internet for their lives and work. We want to understand how to make security and privacy more accessible to everyone, and we value different perspectives and experiences. We strongly encourage people from under-represented communities to apply to help us make the Internet better!

title: Senior Brand Partnerships Manager - Offroad (Remote Considered)
description:
### **ABOUT onX**



As a pioneer in digital outdoor navigation with a suite of apps, onX was founded in Montana, which in turn has inspired our mission to awaken the adventurer inside everyone. With more than 300 employees located around the country working in largely remote / hybrid roles, we have created regional "Basecamps" to help remote employees find connection and inspiration with other onXers. We bring our outdoor passion to work every day, coupling it with industry-leading technology to craft dynamic outdoor experiences.



Through multiple years of growth, we haven't lost our entrepreneurial ethos at onX. We offer a fast-paced, growing, tech-forward environment where ownership, accountability, and passion for winning as a team are essential. We value diversity and believe it leads to different perspectives and inspires both new adventures and new growth. As a team, we're hungry to improve, value innovation, and believe great ideas come from any direction.

### **ABOUT THE TEAM**



onX's Offroad Marketing team is responsible for driving short-term growth while building the foundation and vision for the future. This team is rooted in the off-road industry taking the phrase 'built for off-roaders, by off-roaders' very seriously. We are a group of passionate individuals that care deeply about selling onX Offroad to enable our members to go farther. With a start-up mentality, the group is crafted to have broad skill sets, wear many hats, and have the ability to work through some ambiguous scenarios.


### **WHAT YOU WILL DO**



onX is seeking a **Senior Brand Partnerships Manager** with a background and acumen in business development. This role will be ambiguous as this person helps to identify step-change opportunities, craft strategies, and launch high-level partnerships. This person will support and advance OnX Offroad's business development strategy with a scope that includes but is not limited to: identifying business opportunities and placements for marketing, increasing exposure to potential onX customers, and generating integrations with other brands.



As a Senior Brand Partnerships Manager at onX, you will be responsible for managing all stages of major partnership development, from initial ideation and partner engagement through negotiation and contract execution. Leveraging market insights and industry trends, you will lead the development of sophisticated partner engagement strategies that create value for both onX and its partners. The role will require close coordination with teams across onX and the ability to form strong relationships with external partners' Senior Executives.



In addition to a track record of earning trust and influencing others, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. Your ability to make well-informed decisions and prioritize strategic partnerships will be crucial to improving the chances of success, limiting risk, and enhancing the onX customer experience. Ownership, ambition, and an entrepreneurial spirit are essential. This role will will report to the Director of Vertical Marketing for onX Offroad.


### **As a Senior Brand Partnerships Manager, your essential job duties and responsibilities will look like:**


* Provide critical support to the company's strategic direction by identifying, prioritizing, and pursuing high-impact partnership opportunities that align with onX's growth objectives.
* Serve as a thought partner to internal stakeholders to align strategies with the overall company roadmap, ensuring seamless integration and maximum impact.
* Manage all stages of development for major partnerships, from initial ideation and partner engagement through contract execution. This will generally require managing multiple deals simultaneously.
* Develop thorough business cases and robust financial models for various partnership structures and opportunities.
* Serve as a subject matter expert on partnership strategies, structures, and negotiation techniques, providing guidance and support for internal stakeholders.
* Ability to identify when to pivot and shift focus to areas and efforts that prove to have the highest amount of business impact

### **WHAT YOU'LL BRING**


* Six (6) or more years of business development and marketing experience, with a focus on brand partnership development
* Strong track record in business negotiations and contracting.
* Strong written and verbal communication and the ability to communicate findings and recommendations concisely to senior decision-makers.
* Experience with budgeting and financial modeling.
* Familiarity with the offroad and/or overland market space and community.
* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* A shared passion for and ability to demonstrate onX's Company Values
* Permanent US work authorization is a condition of employment with onX.
* Must be available for travel up to 30%.

### **ADDED BONUSES**



Though not required, we would be thrilled to consider candidates with any of the following:


* Expertise in consumer technology and subscription-based business models.
* A deep personal passion for off-roading.
* A well-established and extensive professional network in key target industries and businesses relevant to onX's strategies.

### **WHERE YOU CAN WORK**



onX has created a thriving distributed workforce community across several US locations. This position can be performed from an onX corporate office, "Basecamp," or "Talent Cluster."


* **Corporate Offices:** onX was founded in Montana with offices in Missoula and Bozeman. If you prefer to work in an office at least part of the time, this is a great option.
* **Basecamps**: onX's Basecamps are established virtual workforce communities where a sizable number of distributed team members group for work, volunteering, socializing, and adventure.
	+ *Our current Basecamps are located within a 90-mile radius of the following: Austin, TX; Charlotte, NC; Denver, CO; Minneapolis, MN; Portland, OR; Salt Lake City, UT; and Seattle, WA.*
* **Connection Hubs**: onX's Connection Hub locations are smaller, emerging communities of distributed team members.
	+ Our current Connection Hubs are located within a 60-mile radius of the following: Boise, ID; Charleston, SC; Dallas/Fort Worth, TX; Phoenix, AZ; Richmond, VA; Spokane, WA; and Vermont.

### **HOW YOU'LL BE COMPENSATED**



onX is committed to compensating all employees fairly and equitably for their contributions. For this position, applicants can expect to make between $115,000 to $135,000 upon hire. The pay range will vary based on experience, skills, certifications, and education among other factors as required in the job description. In addition, full-time onX employees are eligible for a grant of common share options with a vesting schedule and a potential annual bonus of 10% based on company performance.


### **WHAT WE'RE OFFERING YOU**


* Competitive salaries, annual bonuses, equity, and opportunities for growth
* Comprehensive health benefits including a no-monthly-cost medical plan
* Parental leave plan of 5 or 13 weeks fully paid
* 401k matching at 100% for the first 3% you save and 50% from 3-5%
* Company-wide outdoor adventures and amazing outdoor industry perks
* Annual "Get Out, Get Active" funds to fuel your active lifestyle in and outside of the gym
* Flexible time away package that includes PTO, STO, VTO, quiet weeks, and floating holidays

### **PERFORMANCE ESSENTIALS**



In this role, success is driven by cognitive abilities such as concentration and problem-solving, essential for our computer-centric tasks. onX will explore reasonable accommodations to ensure that individuals with diverse abilities can fully engage in and contribute to the essential physical and mental functions of the job. If you need assistance or accommodation, please contact us at PS@onxmaps.com.


### **onX COMPANY VALUES**



Our principles guide the decisions making of our company. They define the culture at onX, what we have learned through experience and are the code by which we operate. They are fundamental, enduring and actionable–a benchmark by which we measure the team behavior and performance.



We put the customer first.



We are passionate.



We win as a team.



We take ownership.



We work with urgency.



We are curious and seek the truth.



We innovate & take risks.

  

**Position open until filled.**


**#LI-Remote**

**At onX, we believe that diversity makes us better**. Bringing together a diverse set of backgrounds, ideas, and opinions helps us to achieve our mission to awaken the adventurer in everyone. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. onX is committed to equal opportunity not only in our hiring practices but also in our employment practices, including but not limited to development, compensation, and promotion. We strive to build an inclusive work community where everyone can be their authentic self, and together, we win as a team. Come join us!



onX does not sell any Personal Information, but we may transfer employment related records to our service providers or third parties that provide business services to onX or as required by law. For more information, see our Privacy Policy.

title: Brand Manager
description:
You are a meticulous planner, yet you have a flair for the creative. You understand the importance of developing inspired marketing messaging and you’re adept at using every channel available to get that content out to the right audiences and measure its effect. You can envision the big picture, still you’re driven to get the little things done.

Are you one of the few unique individuals who can see creative endeavors from both sides? Then keep reading because we’re searching for you.

We are the Vx Group. With offices in Cedarburg, Wis. and Charleston, S.C., our sole purpose is to drive revenue growth for our clients.

With a thorough understanding of a client’s audience, brand values and marketing objectives, your practical “roll up your sleeves and get $%^# done” attitude and passion for producing great content and/or creative deliverables will help drive measurable revenue growth for our clients.

**Brand Management – The Vx Way**

Your goal as Brand Manager is to plan, deliver, and measure creative and marketing solutions across multiple channels for B2B companies. You’ll do this by proactively recommending and organizing projects – both planned and unplanned – and facilitating a consistent monthly flow of creative and marketing deliverables that you will create or collaborate on with your direct team, Program Owner, and internal resources.

Your success will be dependent on two things: your skill to drive creative messaging, plans and projects, and your ability to develop relationships internally and externally and communicate your vision and the results with our clients.

It’s a unique role because it requires you to be able to navigate two very different worlds. It’s going to be challenging, but also kind of fun.

**Professional Requirements:**

At the Vx Group, we provide a work environment that allows you to enjoy a healthy work/life balance, provides access to professional and personal growth opportunities, and (occasionally) have some fun along the way. In return, we expect successful candidates to have:

* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, journalism or related field. Relevant creative and management experience considered in lieu of a traditional degree.
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with business leaders and creative teammates.
* Proven talent to create and communicate creative and marketing plans.
* Comfortable using AI technology like ChatGPT and Jasper to generate niche B2B content and publishing it across multiple channels.
* Stellar written and verbal communications skills.
* Understanding the fundamentals of marketing technology such as SEO, PPC and automation.

**Benefits & Compensation:**

Compensation at Vx Group is based on background education, accomplishments, and applicable experience. We also provide a wide variety of benefits as a part of our total compensation package, including:

* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* 401(k) with employer match
* Generous Paid Time Off
* Flexible remote/in office work environment

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Brand Manager
description:
Job Title: **Brand Manager**


Classification: Exempt; Full-time


Department: Marketing


Location: Reno, Nevada


Reports to: VP Marketing and Business Development


Date: 01/23/2024

 **Position Overview**


The **Brand Manager** is a skilled marketer accountable for driving business planning and marketing execution for Mary’s Gone Cracker’s North America and International territories. The successful candidate will drive sustainable growth with a clear foundation of consumer insights, brand positioning and innovation and consumer-inspired marketing plans that result in sales, profit, share and equity gain. As a Brand Manager, you will focus on the consumer and put them at the center of everything you do. You will thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Your passion for the snack industry and your ability to navigate complexity will be the driving force behind your success.

 **Essential Functions**

* Brand Strategy: Develop a strategic framework for the brand’s growth plans ensuring a sufficient pipeline of products and initiatives. Continuously evolve and refine the brand’s foundations to stay relevant and competitive.
* Brand Activation: Act as a liaison between the brand, integrated marketing teams and external agencies. Lead development and execution of marketing plans to support key products with strong digital, social and shopper marketing mindset. Define campaign Key Performance Indicators and corresponding tactics that align with the brand positioning and target consumer.
* Portfolio Management: Analyze product performance, consumer feedback, research, and market trends to make informed decisions and recommendations about product positioning, messaging, pricing, packaging, formula renovation, SKU prioritization/rationalization, and new item introductions within existing product lines.
* Business Planning: Work closely with the innovation team to create a pipeline of new products that align with the brand’s strategic direction. Lead cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and within budget. Communicate project status, issues, and opportunities to the broader organization.
* Market and Competitor Analysis: Become an expert on the brand and its competitors, continuously monitoring the market landscape and identifying trends and opportunities to guide future plans.
* Data Synthesis and Decision-making: Gather and synthesize data from multiple sources to make informed decisions and recommendations for brand strategy and marketing initiatives.
* Work closely with the Sales team to create compelling selling strategies and build strong plans to secure incremental distribution and drive velocities at key retailers.
* Deliver projects on time and within budget.

 **Other Duties and Responsibilities**

* Strategic Vision: With a keen eye on industry trends and customer insights, you will develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies that align with our long-term business goals.
* Project Management: Our fast-paced environment demands effective project management skills to oversee multiple marketing projects concurrently. You will play a key role in ensuring projects adhere to aggressive timelines.
* Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will be proficient at inspiring and influencing cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration, and ensuring a cohesive approach to marketing initiatives with internal and external stakeholders.
* Results-Driven Performance: Ownership of business results is at the core of this role. You will diligently track key indicators, analyze data, and draw actionable insights to optimize marketing strategies. You will proactively recommend and implement adjustments to plans to maximize success.
* Other duties as assigned.

 **Supervisory Responsibility**


This position will be an individual contributor.

 **Travel**


Occasional overnight travel (up to 20%) by land and/or air

 **Mental and Physical Demands**

* Light physical activity performing non-strenuous daily activities of an administrative nature
* Manual dexterity sufficient to reach and handle items
* Ability to have clear vision at 20 inches or less, or 20 feet or more
* Ability to identify and distinguish colors
* Ability to adjust focus to bring an object into sharp focus

 **Physical Demands**

 **% of time**

  

Stand

  

10%

  

Walk

  

10%

  

Sit

  

80%

  

Talk

  

50%

  

Hearing/Listening

  

50%

  

Use hands to finger, handle, or feel

  

70%

  

Reach with hands and arms

  

20%

  

Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl

  

1%

  

Taste or Smell

  

1%

  

Lift up to 10 pounds

  

60%

  

Lift up to 25 pounds

  

1%

  

Lift up to 50 pounds

  

0%

 **Work Environment**

* Well-lighted, heated and/or air-conditioned indoor office setting with adequate ventilation
* Atmosphere with moderate noise

 **Required Education, Experience, Certifications, and licenses**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field (MBA preferred).
* 4-6 years of proven experience in brand management or strategic marketing. Relevant industry experience in food and/or consumer goods is strongly preferred.
* Strong creative thinking with demonstrated ability to build programs with creative, digital, social, public relations, and agency partners.
* Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills with an ability to influence and collaborate cross functionally across multiple leadership levels and external agencies.
* Analytical thinking & problem solving: The ability to analyze complex data to identify key insights and barriers to growth with the purpose of proposing solutions and action plans to grow the business.
* Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks within tight timeframes and deadlines in a dynamic ever-changing working environment.
* Entrepreneur can-do attitude to find ways to break down growth barriers and navigate and perform in changing circumstances.
* Demonstrated positive energy to effectively represent brand internally and externally.

 **Core Competencies**

* Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquires or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conforms to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.
* Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plant and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
* Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables
* Proficient personal computer skills including electronic mail, record keeping, routine database activity, word processing, spreadsheet, graphics, etc.

 *Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.*

title: Sr. Brand Manager, Brand Building [Remote or Hybrid]
description:
**Job Title:** Senior Brand Manager, Brand Building

**Reports to:** Director of Marketing

**Direct Report(s):** ABM Brand Building

**Job Type:** Full Time

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

**Location:** Remote (West Coast Preferred)

 **Purpose of the Role:**


This person will be an integral team leader, helping to achieve Stash’s in year business goals as they create and execute marketing strategies to deliver results. They will be instrumental in driving brand success by leveraging data, consumer research, and branding fundamentals to develop and execute the Stash Brand Plan.


This role requires a driven, creative, and analytical leader to impact a broad array of projects to complete our company objectives. Be a key part of our Marketing squad, by leading the go to market strategy for the brand including brand positioning, integrated marketing planning, and business analysis. Manage two direct reports to create a positive working environment and deliver team objectives.


Our perfect fit is a self motivated and collaborative leader who is excited to contribute to a fun, fast paced, high performance team. We’re looking for someone with high potential to fill this role and continue to grow their career as we grow our business.

 **Responsibilities:**

* **Brand Strategy Development**: Collaborate on the development of the overall brand strategy, brand vision and value proposition for short as well as long term. Translate strategies into tactics and deliver brand growth.
* **Performance Analysis**: Monitor and analyze market trends, research consumer markets, and competitors’ activities to identify opportunities and key issues. Own marketing team business analysis including Business review and S&OP.
* **Marketing Campaigns**: Contributing to the strategy and planning of innovative marketing campaigns across various platforms and channels (retail, print, digital, social media, etc.), ensuring the alignment with the brand's vision and goals. Strong focus on CPG retail shopper marketing and digital initiatives to help drive sales velocities.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration**: Collaborate with sales, production, finance and other teams as necessary to develop strategy and lead execution of marketing and promotional materials that maintain our brand standards and integrity
* **Market Research**: Conduct comprehensive market research to understand consumer trends, competitive landscape, and market opportunities. Use data-driven insights to inform brand positioning and marketing strategies.
* **Budget Management**: Manage and allocate the brand budget effectively to meet marketing and advertising needs.

 **Core Skills:**

* **Strategic Thinking**: Commitment to strategic prioritization, involving strategically managing tasks and projects and making the most of available resources to achieve goals.
* **Enterprise Mindset**: Innate enterprise mindset, always thinking about the bigger picture and recognizing how Marketing decisions impact organizational objectives.
* **Effective Communication**: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively collaborate with internal teams, external agencies, and to represent the company.
* **Time Management**: Using time efficiently to complete projects ahead of schedule when possible, including monitoring deadlines and managing workload effectively.
* **Innovative Mindset**: Ability to foster and champion innovation, encouraging new ideas and driving the development of innovative products.

 **Core Behaviors:**

* **Creativity**: Ability to develop innovative marketing campaigns and strategies that increase brand awareness, consumer engagement, and profitability.
* **Agility**: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, often under pressure. Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Ability to quickly incorporate feedback and coaching to drive optimized results. Good problem-solving abilities and detail-oriented. Openness to travel as needed for the role.
* **Analytical Skills**: Strong ability to analyze market data, consumer behaviors, and campaign performance to inform brand strategies and decisions. You are consistently integrating the “so what” into your analyses and presentations.
* **Accountability**: Strong sense of accountability and willingness to own work outside of your remit as necessary. Demonstrated self awareness, including ability to own mistakes and learn from them. You are a resourceful self-starter who is excited to lean into the work and be a team player.
* **Relationship Building**: Emphasis on cross-functional collaboration, determined to understand others’ motivations, and dedicated interest in building rapport with team members both in and outside of the Marketing department.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree or an MBA would be a plus.
* At least 5-7 years of experience in brand management, preferably in the beverage or FMCG sector.
* Proficiency in using marketing software and social media platforms.

 **Physical Requirements:**


For the role of Brand Manager, Brand Building, the physical requirements are generally minimal due to the office-based nature of the job. However, some physical demands may include:

* Regularly required to sit for extended periods.
* Frequently required to use a computer, including typing and viewing a monitor.
* Regularly required to talk and/or listen in conversations with customers and team members, both in-person and over the phone.
* Occasionally may need to lift and move small office supplies, up to 25 lbs.
* Occasional travel may be required for trade shows or meetings, which could involve standing for long periods, walking long distances, and transporting light materials.
* Good manual dexterity for the use of common office equipment such as computer keyboards, monitors, copiers, and scanners.

  

Note: The above physical requirements are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  

The annual pay range for this full-time position is $105,000 - $135,000 + benefits. Our pay ranges are guided by the discipline, level, and experience required. Within the range, individual pay may vary based on additional factors, including your specific location, desired skills/ technical competency, relevant experience, and advanced education/ training. Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D, LTD, EAP, Wellness Stipend + 401(k) match.

**Yamamotoyama is an equal opportunity employer. At Yamamotoyama, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment that cultivates creativity and innovation. Although rich in history, innovation is woven into our DNA, and this demands diversity of thought. Our commitment to serving our community wholeheartedly compels us to embrace a broad spectrum of perspectives, backgrounds, regions, and experiences.**

title: Channel Marketing Manager
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security
At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 11,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond.
Channel Marketing Manager - Remote United States
This position is responsible for leading the development and execution of channel marketing activities and programs for Allegion Home and its eCommerce focused retailers This includes the demand generation and promotion of both mechanical and electronic products to consumers. This position will lead creation of new strategic ideas and promote collaboration with the sales and marketing teams to achieve business goals and growth for Allegion. The role includes direct responsibility for marketing, promotions, partner co-marketing, product launches, content and demand generation strategies and execution. The position will partner with a team to create a winning and inclusive culture, focus on engagement, and foster collaborative relationships and partnerships with all internal partners.
What You Will Do:* Develop the marketing program for two select retail partners, both ecommerce-focused
* Ensure execution of all strategic initiatives, promotions, and programs in partnership with Sales
* Assist in the development of Marketing strategies in support of strategic vision for assigned channel, ensuring link to business plans and strategy
* Execute on channel priorities, objectives, and overall marketing plan, including promotions, content, demand generation activities, and any applicable product launch campaigns for assigned accounts or retailers
* Collaborate with Brand Management, Digital Marketing, Sales, Product Management and Training Team
* Lead content aggregation, distribution, and optimization within assigned retail account(s)
* Understand target audience(s) key needs/desires and purchase behavior in their purchase journey
* For retail line and business reviews, partner with sales team to develop the recommendations for go-forward support plan, which will include the annual marketing plan to support the assortment recommendation
* Support new product introduction marketing efforts including collateral and/or content development, demand creation plans and communication strategy, retail launch plans and/or training tools and execution.
* Develop strong relationships with retail partners to assess customer needs, drive alignment of channel marketing budget with key business initiatives, and communicate and prioritize channel needs
* Support development and management of channel marketing budget, expenses, and forecasts
* Analyze data to track marketing effectiveness (i.e., promotion, digital) and identify new opportunities or strategies. Build business cases, oversee financial analysis, and gather internal support/approval for various initiatives supporting the channel
* Represent Channel Marketing in cross functional meetings within the organization
* Maintain partnerships amongst cross-functional teams such as Sales, Brand and Product by sharing data, updates, and strategy to support marketing related initiatives
* Understand, analyze, monitor, action and continuously improve strategic internal and external partner KPIs, VOC, competitive activities, trends, etc. for marketing, planning and growth purposes
* Prepare and create final content, agenda regarding monthly sales calls


What You Need to Succeed:* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Finance, or Business or related field
* 5+ years of channel marketing or related experience eCommerce marketing experience strongly preferred
* Strong business acumen with proven strategic account planning and a track record of profitable growth
* Experience with the implementation of growth and marketing initiatives that lead to stronger market advantages
* Strong project management skills with the ability to execute/implement on strategic design
* Proven leadership skills with the ability communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Strong written and verbal communication abilities (able to clearly, concisely share information to appropriate stakeholders internally and externally with appropriate level of detail/context), strong presentation skills
* Outstanding interpersonal skills and influencing skills at all levels in the organization
* Ability to travel 10%
* This position will be remote, but candidate must live within the United States


Why Work for Us?
Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if:* You're seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others. With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it”.
* You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development. As we grow, we want you to grow with us.
* You want a culture that promotes work-life balance. Our employees enjoy generous paid time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work!


What You’ll Get from Us:* Health, dental and vision insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy”
* Paid time off
* A commitment to your future with a 401K plan, which currently offers a 6% company match and no vesting period
* Health Savings Accounts – Tax-advantaged savings account used for healthcare expenses
* Flexible Spending Accounts – Tax-advantaged spending accounts for healthcare and/or dependent daycare expenses
* Disability Insurance –Short-Term and Long-Term coverage, paid for by Allegion, provides income replacement for illness or injury
* Life Insurance – Term life coverage with the option to purchase supplemental coverage
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Voluntary Wellness Program – Simply complete wellness activities and earn up to $2,000 in rewards
* Employee Discounts through Perks at Work
* Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”
* Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through CliftonStrengths assessment & coaching


Compensation: This range is provided by Allegion. Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience.* The expected Base Salary Range: $70,700 – $131,300. The actual compensation will be determined based on experience and other factors permitted by law.
* Bonus Eligible: Yes


Apply Today!
Join our team of experts today and help us make tomorrow’s world a safer place!*Not sure if your experience perfectly aligns with the role?* *Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification* *and* *every single preferred qualification of a job posting. At Allegion, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every item in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this role.*
We Celebrate Who We Are!
Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do. We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team.
