title: Director of Brand Marketing
description:
**#KeepGrowing with Nutrafol**
------------------------------



Come grow with us. We're a growing company. Everything we do, we do to help people grow into the best version of themselves.



As the pioneers of hair wellness, we create natural, clinically effective solutions for hair growth and provide support for people at every step of their hair journey. Our multi-factorial approach targets the root causes of hair thinning using a patented blend of medical-grade botanicals - and is recommended by over 3,000 physicians and hair professionals for trusted, reliable results.



We never settle, and are continuously challenging existing treatments and methodologies to advance the frontier of hair science. As we help our customers grow, we grow too - by embracing individuality and differences, leading by example, and empowering ourselves and others with our passion for wellness and innovation.



Keep growing. It's our mantra. Our commitment to helping anybody and everybody committed to realizing their own potential to grow.


The Director Brand Marketing is the strategic, creative, storyteller that will drive Nutrafol brand strategy, campaign and content. They are responsible for developing and executing on the brand narrative across a core product line to build a strong emotional connection with our customers. As a brand leader, doer and activator of a DTC brand you will work cross functionally to develop and execute a range of projects from 360 campaigns, strategic initiatives, social narrative and more.



Solutions-oriented candidate with a creative mind that can craft brand stories that resonate with consumers, and initiatives that impact consumer perceptions. Responsibilities include conducting research, analyzing findings, making recommendations, ideating collaboratively with creative and overseeing projects through to completion. Should be a strategic thinker with a knack for uncovering consumer insights that inform strategy development. The Director Brand Marketing reports to the VP, Brand Marketing and is highly collaborative with the in-house teams PR, creative, growth, retention and brand product marketing teams.


**Responsibilities:**


* Develop holistic brand experiences based on extensive research, experience, competitor and brand knowledge
* Conduct extensive primary and secondary research
* Create competitive reviews and situational analyses
* Staying up-to-date on consumer research and market trends
* Identify insights, challenges and opportunities
* Develop brand architecture, positioning and strategy
* Write compelling brand stories
* Brief and collaborate with creative teams
* Leading ideation and brainstorming sessions
* Lead day-to-day management of key brand initiatives to drive awareness and engagement
* Set brand strategy and direction for partnerships and collaborations
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously leading cross functional stakeholders
* Monitor results, provide strategic recommendation and roadmaps for improvement
* Assist in creating and managing brand marketing budget
* Champion the brand and customer at all times
* Create strong relationships and build trust with cross-functional teams and leadership
* Work with external vendors and freelancers to execute as needed

  


**Requirements:**


* 8-12 years of marketing, brand management or similar experience in a fast growing brand; wellness and DTC experience is required. Subscription based company model preferred.
* 5+ years of team management experience
* Proven track record creating and executing innovative and disruptive integrated brand strategies and campaigns (across digital, social, CRM, OOH, direct response, etc.) for a DTC brand with supporting distribution channels
* Demonstrated experience within high-growth, fast-moving start-up environments, particularly with DTC branded service model
* Experience managing in-house teams and agency relationships
* Strong strategic and analytical thinker with experience in customer segmentation and quantitative and qualitative customer insights to create
* Proven track record for developing holistic brand-first marketing strategies
* Love of all things brand and high attention to detail
* Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
* Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive
* Positive attitude and ability to manage change, thrive in a fast-paced environment, work though ambiguity, and prioritize projects based on business needs

Nutrafol takes into consideration a wide range of factors in final compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs. The listed range is applicable only to the annual base salary and does not include additional perks, benefits, or applicable bonus eligibility comprising the total compensation package.**Salary Range:**


$170,000—$190,000 USD#### **Perks & Benefits**


* Fully remote work experience
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision package, including FSA program
* 401K with 50% match
* Flexible PTO
* Two company-wide wellness breaks every day
* Free lunch on us every Tuesday and Thursday via Seamless/Grubhub
* Monthly wellness stipend
* Monthly internet stipend
* Monthly cell phone stipend
* Annual learning & development stipend
* Wellness Program, including virtual Wellness Sessions & No-Meeting Wednesdays
* Free meditation app membership (Headspace)
* Free Nutrafol subscription
* Pet insurance and benefit programs

title: Director of Brand Growth & Development
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced creative leader to join our team as the **Director of Brand Growth & Development**. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping our overall brand presence on all platforms, executing our social media strategy, and leading our creative services and graphic design team to produce visually stunning and engaging content.

This position is full-time and exempt from overtime. The Director of Brand Growth and Development will report to the Senior Director of Strategic Growth and Development.

**Responsibility Overview**

* Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with PFN's brand and objectives.
* Oversee and manage day-to-day operations of social media accounts across multiple platforms, ensuring consistent and high-quality content.
* Oversee and manage the day-to-day creative services team in developing visually compelling and shareable content for all platforms.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align social media and creative services with content, marketing, and other business objectives.
* Lead both social and creative services teams to build content experiences that drive audience interaction and engagement.
* Stay updated on industry trends and leverage insights to enhance the effectiveness of social media campaigns.
* Monitor and analyze key performance metrics to optimize social media performance and drive audience engagement.
* Foster an inclusive, collaborative, and innovative environment within social and creative services teams, promoting continuous improvement and excellence.

**Primary Qualifications**

***Required***

* 5+ years of proven experience in managing social media accounts for a sports media company.
* Proven success ideating and leading original, sponsorable, social-first content that drives revenue.
* Strong understanding of sports audiences, with a focus on NFL, NCAA football, fantasy football, and sports betting.
* Demonstrated success in developing and executing social media strategies that drive audience growth and engagement.
* Experience leading and managing a creative services or graphic design team.
* Exceptional communication and leadership skills.
* In-depth knowledge of social media platforms, trends, and best practices.

***Great to have***

* Experience collaborating in a digital newsroom environment.
* Experience executing sponsored social activations.
* Experience working with a diverse range of talent, including creators, reporters, athletes, and influencers from all walks of life.
* An eye-popping portfolio of beloved social media creations that have been sponsored, gone viral, driven conversation, and won awards.
* Experience guiding, launching, and developing new brands, pitch decks, and sales materials.

We believe that diversity and inclusion are essential to our success as a company, and we strive to create an inclusive work environment that promotes mutual respect and collaboration.

title: Sr. Director, Brand Strategy
description:
**Company Description**  

At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.


With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™.


Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.


Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a visionary and inspirational Head of Brand Strategy to join the team that is the beating heart of the ServiceNow movement, and to help us take our brand to new heights. We are seeking a dynamic leader to steer our brand strategy and drive the company towards a future where our brand is as influential as our industry-leading technology.

**What You Will Get To Do:**

* **Brand Strategy Development & Leadership:** Develop and help to implement a comprehensive long-term brand framework and strategy that aligns with our business objectives, and successfully positions as we continue our expansion beyond IT and into/across the full enterprise.
* **Brand Evangelist**. Help to educate our entire company on the importance of brand and what makes for an iconic brand. What does a great brand look like, why it has huge impact in driving business results, and how every person, every interaction, every email, every handshake is part of creating our brand.
* **Outside-In Perspective:** Bring insights and understanding from the real world back to the stakeholders at ServiceNow, and help our organization better understand our audiences (C-suite, developers, BU leads, employees, etc.) and the market to inform more impactful and relevant marketing.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Partner with stakeholders and agency partners to craft strategies for various programs, teams, etc. – all of which will tie back to our larger brand strategy; helping to ensure a cohesive and consistent brand presence that drives our organization forward.
* **Creative Inspiration:** Deliver insight-rich briefs that will inspire creative teams (both internally and externally) to develop impactful and breakthrough work that will build our brand and propel our business.
* **Brand Performance. Establish a vision and measurement strategy** that evaluates and assesses various aspects of our brand’s performance, and the impact of the initiatives and investment that we put into market. Leverage a range of sources (industry data, brand health data, etc.) to make the ongoing case for brand – the academic case for “why brand” as well as demonstrating the efficacy of the work we’re doing with our brand efforts and investment.
* **Naming.** Oversee our naming practice: optimizing our naming strategy and processes, and working with stakeholders to name our growing portfolio of programs and products/solutions.

 **Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* 15+ years of experience in brand strategy, including time spent working for/at a company in the B2B Technology space.
* Demonstrated ability to simplify – boiling vast amounts of information down to simple, insightful nuggets that teams can action and build great creative and communications around.
* Firm believer in the power of brand to attract and activate audiences, to drive awareness and consideration, and positively impact the business.
* Experience working with creative groups (either in-house or at agencies) and an ability to craft insight-rich strategies and briefs that will inform great creative work.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a keen ability to inspire and guide diverse teams.
* Ability to navigate constant change in a fast-moving and fast-growing organization.
* Results-oriented mindset with a focus on measurable business impact, and the ability to make the business case for brand.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, business or a related field is preferred.
* Masters degree preferred.


For positions in the Bay Area, we offer a base pay of $212,100 - $381,900, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs (subject to eligibility requirements). Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located, and is subject to change based on work location.

 **Additional Information**  

ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.

If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.


For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.

title: Brand Partnerships Sales Director
description:
**Brand Partnerships Sales Director**  

At Cooler Screens, we’ve built a culture of meritocracy, integrity, and pragmatism, where we work and celebrate together to re-imagine the in-store shopping experience. Cooler Screens is backed and led by some of the most prominent Chicago and Silicon Valley leaders, advisers, and investors to develop a digital solution to transform a multi-billion dollar retail and advertising industry, while positively affecting the buying experiences of consumers in the US and beyond. Our startup spirit and growth mindset support our teammates as they build the future of retail and media. We’re looking for people who have an innate drive to do more, own more, and make an impact both on the business and in their careers.  

Key to our growth goals is a world-class, high-performing Brand Sales Team. The Brand Sales team is built on hustle, practicing a builder’s mindset, delivering on the highest of standards for customers, and living a team-first mentality. That’s why we’re seeking a qualified Director of Brand Partnerships to accelerate ad revenue growth by owning sales and account management processes end-to-end with existing and new CPG brands.
  

As the face of Cooler Screens to top tier CPG brands and agencies, an ideal Brand Partnerships Sales Director will . . .
* Establish new, and deepen existing, relationships through contact mapping, prospecting, account coverage, and meetings/pitches.
* Build best-in-class account plans to up-level outreach and pitch materials, “own the room” during meetings, and align all strategy back to brand goals.
* Grow revenue sources by developing/advancing campaign opportunities, securing strategic investment with JBPs, etc.
* Seek out and act on opportunities to benefit the team through best practice sharing and ownership of tools, mechanisms, resources, materials, or processes.

**Who you are:*** Expansive experience and a track record of success in selling advertising to customers with brands and agencies from front-line managers to senior executives.
* Experience/Comfort working in a fast-paced startup environment where change, learning, and adaptation is continuous.
* “Scrappy” and willing to do whatever it takes to secure meetings, build materials, develop new opportunities, create urgency, etc.
* Adept at leading with consumer experience, data, and insights to drive home meaningful, yet easy to understand, solutions and results tied back to customer needs.
* Able to identify areas for improvement and own solutions to benefit your own performance and that of the team.
* A passion for winning and celebrating together as a team!

  

**You have:*** 10+ years of advertising sales experience, including Retail Media sales.
* Experience working in fast-paced, startup environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills to convey value propositions, overcome objections, and simplify data and insights.
* Proficiency with PPT, Excel, and Online tools and Dashboards.

**About Cooler Screens**  

We are transforming retail cooler surfaces into IoT-enabled screens. Our media platform reimagines the brick-and-mortar shopping experience for consumers in-store, while delivering new marketing opportunities and smart merchandising for brands and retailers.
  

We are a remote work company and have an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paid time off, and many other perks.
  

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, native origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.

title: Brand Marketing Manager
description:
Company Description

Hexin Technology Inc. is a leading global e-commerce company in Xiamen, China, specializing in functional shapewear. The company focuses on independent research and development of marine biotechnology fabric technology, independent design of product structures and patterns, and outsourcing production and processing. With self-built overseas warehouses, Hexin Technology has been recognized with several honors, including "National High-tech Enterprise" and "Fujian Province Science and Technology Little Giant Leading Enterprise".

Role Description

This is a full-time remote role for a Brand Marketing Manager. The Brand Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and implementing brand strategies, managing product launches, conducting market research, and overseeing social media campaigns. The Brand Marketing Manager will also manage and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive business growth.

Qualifications

* Experience in brand management, product launches, and market research
* Expertise in developing and executing strategic marketing plans
* Experience in managing social media campaigns and online advertising
* Strong collaboration and communication skills to work cross-functionally with teams
* Strong analytical skills to analyze data and interpret market trends
* Ability to work independently and remotely
* Experience in the apparel industry is a plus
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for branding and a track record of success, we would love to hear from you. Join our team as a Brand Manager and help us take our brand to new heights!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $79,256.00 - $87,694.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Branding: 3 years (Required)
* D2C Marketing: 3 years (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Content Project Manager(Brand,Veeva,Global Regulations,Pharmaceutical)
description:
**Job Description:**

* Assist with ensuring that the Global Brand Teams and Affiliates have the appropriate resources, processes, and technology in place to execute appropriate content strategy initiatives successfully.
* This role will be critical in preparing for and launching the roll-out of the Core Claims Library Global Phase 0 roll-out, as well as supporting other ad-hoc Content Excellence initiatives such as our content production transition to steady state and work within Veeva Brand Portals.

**Responsibilities:**  
**Core Claims Library:**

* Serve as a key member for the Core Claims Library Initiative, acting as the main point of contact for relevant Global Brand Teams (GBTs) as they understand what core claims are, how they can help and what's in it for them
* Co-create a change management plan to support all stakeholders' transition through each phase of the initiative (preparation, transition, steady state).
* Lead the extraction, preparation, and upload for approval of core claims for predefined GBT
* Including preparing for Core Claims Week, where business rules, claim variations and approval processes will be defined with key stakeholders
* With support from external vendors, lead the creation of two key training documents (MLOR and marketing/ creative agency training pathways) and plan for the effective implementation
* Support the plan to build an effective business case, to attain Senior Leadership buy-in for the expansion of the Core Claims Library across other GBTs by the end of 2024

**Hybrid Content Production Model:**

* Ensure a close alignment to our 3 established Global Brand Liaisons who support GBTs with their content production plans and builds
* Provide updates to the three business units via monthly touchpoints, to communicate any new, refined or updated content production processes/ technologies
* Escalate any issues with the quality of production or service to Content Excellence leadership
* Ideate on process or technology enhancements to provide a better service to GBTs
* Update SharePoint Site with key documentation, resources and success stories to build positivity around the model

**Veeva Brand Portals:**

* JIRA Form Transition
* All previous content central requests (content uploads, withdrawals, brand portal changes such as imagery, widgets etc.) were all handled directly by an internal resouce via receiving messages via email/ teams
* We now have an external team who handles all requests (still sent via email). Expectation is that the GBTs/ creative agencies will complete a simple JIRA form, sent automatically to our external vendor, who will complete requests within 24-48 hours
* You will be expected to:
* Communicate the need for change and process for how they make requests (Video and email sent to all GBTs)
* Manage internal GBT relationships during the transition phase (bi-weekly drop in sessions, individual calls e.g.)
* Manage external partner through close collaboration and touch-points to discuss issues, disturbances, SLA issues etc.
* Escalate issues to internal leadership if required

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* 3 to 5 years of experience in content development and approvals
* Experience and knowledge of Veeva Vault
* Experience in management of a 3rd party vendor
* Ability to understand business requirements and articulate potential solutions
* Experience fulfilling customer needs and managing expectations
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Understanding of life sciences content management principles and taxonomies
* Understanding of life sciences regulated environment

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $42.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Brand Manager
description:
Job Summary:


**WHO ARE WE?**

Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company, comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, and Live Nation Media & Sponsorship. Ticketmaster is the global leader in event ticketing with over 500 million tickets sold annually and more than 12,000 clients worldwide. Live Nation Concerts is the largest provider of live entertainment in the world promoting more than 40,000 shows and 100+ festivals annually for nearly 4,000 artists in over 40 countries. These businesses allow Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to create strategic music marketing programs that connect over 1,000 brands with the 98 million fans that attend Live Nation Entertainment events each year. For additional information, visit www.livenationentertainment.com .


**WHO ARE YOU?**

Passionate and driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward-thinking, and collaborative. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you, please read on!


**THE BRAND MANAGEMENT TEAM**

The Brand Management team is the get stuff done, turn-problems-into-solutions, make our clients look like the rock stars, driving force within the Live Nation Media & Sponsorship division. We are a collection of resourceful, ambitious, and strategic-minded individuals that thrive in an environment full of variables and unknowns. If you like to sit at a desk, write white papers, and theorize on how things should work this is not the job or team for you. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, we should talk.


**THE JOB**

The Senior Brand Manager leads day-to-day relationship and activities of Live Nation’s strategic marketing partnership with our top corporate brands within our team’s Beverage Alcohol vertical. They will be directly involved in maximizing the value of the client relationship and performance of client’s entertainment marketing programs with a focus on:


* Client Relationship Service
* Program Activation & Performance
* Financial Performance, Budget Planning & Reporting
* Team Management & Development
* Innovation & Growth

**WHAT THIS ROLE WILL DO**

* Manage a portfolio of clients across Beverage Alcohol
* Continuously strengthen client relationships through exceptional client service, detailed knowledge of client’s industry and business, impeccable program delivery and client
* Develop and grow relationships with key Live Nation teams (i.e., Digital and social media, Promotions, Talent, Content Production, Legal, Finance, Research, etc.) to ensure the desired program delivery and results for clients
* Support VP, Brand Director, Sales lead, Creative Solutions, and Integrated Marketing team, with developing strategic roadmap, creative programs, and business development/growth opportunities for key client relationships
* When required, review and edit relevant deal points and contracts for potential client programs and actively work with Sales and Legal to complete contract process
* Ensure delivery of contractual agreements including planning, execution, measurement, and reporting and proactively resolve any challenges with asset delivery
* Serve as key point of contact for all client specific financials including overall profitability, projections, and program budgets, including tracking expenses and identifying savings
* Lead key client meetings throughout the year, in-person and over phone – i.e., mid-campaign reviews, end of year recap/renewal discussions, etc., including development of presentations for meetings
* Oversee for all on-site activities for venues, festivals/venue, custom events, artist experiences and hospitality programs including coordination with venue staff, festival production leads, and/or third-party activation agencies
* Fully understand the Live Nation Digital ecosystem, and work directly with LN Digital Planning team to ensure all digital media programs are fully executed and optimized
* Development and delivery of program recaps in a timely manner, with analytical business results and key insights to improve and grow the business
* Assist clients in achieving ROI goals that will ensure maximum renewal opportunity
* Explore marketing trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to add value to sponsorship programs

**WHAT THIS PERSON WILL BRING**

* 4+ years direct experience in brand management, client service, media or entertainment, and/or marketing consulting, advertising or activation agencies
* Must have agency AND event experience, music industry & beverage alcohol experience a plus
* Record of success building, selling, and delivering innovative marketing programs with measurable results
* Experience with marketing programs that blend physical and digital components preferred
* Work with recognizable global brands preferred
* Success working with cross-functional teams
* Knowledge of consumer and market research with ability to implement into decision-making and management
* Track record for developing and growing client relationships
* Passion for excellence and executing high-profile marketing programs
* Superior project management and organizational skills including managing multiple projects simultaneously
* Ability to proactively identify potential problems and utilize sound decision making to implement the best solutions, relying on managers to provide input and solutions only when necessary
* Deep curiosity about emerging marketing trends and ability to integrate into client programs
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications including Keynote, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
* Strong passion for music, including knowledge of current/relevant artists and industry trends
* Ability to travel 30% of time or more in season, often nights and weekends and occasionally without significant advanced notice

Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa


**BENEFITS & PERKS**

Our motto is ‘Taking Care of Our Own’ through 6 pillars of benefits:


**HEALTH:** Medical, Vision and Dental benefits for you and your family, including Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Health Savings Accounts (HSAs)


**YOURSELF: Gene** rous paid time off policy including paid holidays, sick time and paid days off for your birthday, Free concert tickets


**WEALTH:** 401(k) program with company match, Stock Program


**FAMILY:** New parent programs & support including caregiver leave and baby bonuses, infertility support


**CAREER:** Tuition reimbursement, student loan repayment internal growth and development programs & trainings


**OTHERS:** Volunteer time off, crowdfunding network


Live Nation’s policy regarding vaccinations and masking will evolve based upon updated regulations and factors related to COVID-19. Currently, we strongly encourage employees to be fully vaccinated or have received a negative COVID test within [24] hours of entering an office.


**EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY**

We are passionate and committed to our people and go beyond the rhetoric of diversity and inclusion. You will be working in an inclusive environment and be encouraged to bring your whole self to work. We will do all that we can to help you successfully balance your work and homelife. As a growing business we will encourage you to develop your professional and personal aspirations, enjoy new experiences, and learn from the talented people you will be working with. It’s talent that matters to us and we encourage applications from people irrespective of their gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status or caring responsibilities.  



  

Live Nation strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of age (40 and over), ancestry, color, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), family and medical care leave or the denial of family and medical care leave, mental or physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), marital status, domestic partner status, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, military and veteran status, political affiliation, national origin (including language use restrictions), citizenship, race, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, and gender expression, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law, rule, ordinance or regulation.


We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the California Fair Chance Act and consistent with other similar and / or applicable laws in other areas.


We also afford equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability. For this reason, Live Nation will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant consistent with its legal obligations to do so, including reasonable accommodations related to pregnancy in accordance with applicable local, state and / or federal law. As part of its commitment to make reasonable accommodations, Live Nation also wishes to participate in a timely, good faith, interactive process with a disabled applicant to determine effective reasonable accommodations, if any, which can be made in response to a request for accommodations. Applicants are invited to identify reasonable accommodations that can be made to assist them to perform the essential functions of the position they seek. Any applicant who requires an accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of the job should contact a Human Resources Representative to request the opportunity to participate in a timely interactive process. Live Nation will also provide reasonable religious accommodations on a case by case basis.


**HIRING PRACTICES**  

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.


Live Nation recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.


New York City Hiring Rate\\*: $70,000


\\*\\*Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the New York Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements Law. It is estimated based on what a successful New York applicant might be paid. It assumes that the successful candidate will be in New York or perform the position in New York. Similar positions located outside of New York will not necessarily receive the same compensation. Live Nation takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the NY Law, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.


California Hiring Pay Range\\*: $70,000


\\*\\*Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the California Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements Law. It is estimated based on what a successful California applicant might be paid. It assumes that the successful candidate will be in California or perform the position from California. Similar positions located outside of California will not necessarily receive the same compensation. Live Nation takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the California Law, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.
