title: Marketing Manager
description:
The Fiber Broadband Association is the largest organization in the world solely focused on accelerating the deployment of fiber optics broadband communications. The Fiber Broadband Association provides advocacy, education and resources to companies, organizations and communities who want to deploy the best networks through fiber to the home, fiber to the business and fiber everywhere. Fiber Broadband Association members represent the entire broadband ecosystem: service providers, suppliers, consultants, consumers, policymakers, high-tech companies and application providers.

DESCRIPTION:

While our advocacy is DC-based, our employees are able to work from anywhere they can be the most productive. The FBA professional staff is currently a small team but we have a large number of contributors from nearly 500 member companies in North America and over 100 companies in Latin America. The Fiber Broadband Association is seeking qualified applications for our Marketing Manager position. We are looking for a self-starting, detail-oriented, independent team member with outstanding writing skills, creative skills, social media expertise, digital marketing and website experience, messaging and positioning skills, personal interaction abilities, marketing strategy experience and industry knowledge. The position will report to the Vice President of Operations and will play a critical role in managing the organization’s marketing and communications, and will be responsible for developing the organization’s overall marketing strategy and building campaigns to deliver messaging and promotion of the organization’s outbound initiatives.

QUALITIES:

The ideal candidate will have a passion for enabling the growth and success of an organization through strengthening and amplifying the organization’s voice in the industry and the value we bring to members through our programs. Additional qualities include:

* High energy and a strong passion for advancing our message
* Strong organizational and project management skills and attention to detail
* Proven track record in designing and executing successful marketing campaigns
* Ability to manage the marketing department and staff
* Ability to manage our PR Agency, creative skills and/or experience managing a creative agency
* Excellent digital marketing skills, including website management and email marketing
* Outstanding messaging and communications skills
* Strong communications and interpersonal skills and ability to interact and work effectively with all of the organization's key contacts
* Problem solver and willingness to take initiative and try new approaches and propose new solutions
* Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment
* Ability to work on tight deadlines and on longer-term projects
* Commitment to teamwork and the support of teammates in an atmosphere of trust, communication, and encouragement

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

* Lead all aspects of the Association’s marketing/communication programs and campaigns
* Brand ambassador responsible for all aspects of the Association’s brand management and asset creation
* Key point of contact for our PR Agency and the promotion of our annual conference and events
* Key point of contact for our Creative Agency, providing direction on brand consistency
* Responsible for developing the creative content and brand consistency across all of the organization’s assets and initiatives, leveraging internal and external creative resources
* Key point of contact with external graphic designer and through which all team requests are funneled
* Provide leadership and direction for the organization’s marketing committee
* Work with leadership and outside vendors to create and promote a revenue-generating Training and Certification program based on the organization’s work
* Ensure all relevant website content is current and up to date
* Key individual in ensuring quality and approval of FBA weekly newsletter, online blog and magazine as developed by PR agency
* Manage all aspects of email marketing platform including, management of email database, new templates design, content creation, copy and scheduling
* Preferred: basic graphic design skills utilizing the Adobe suite of products or similar software

Other responsibilities to be determined based on the needs of the organization and the skills and experience of the chosen applicant.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

* Bachelor's degree, MBA is a plus
* Experience within Telecom, Broadband, or Network Operator Industries is required
* Strong people skills
* Passion, enthusiasm and confidence
* Creative
* Strong writing and communications skills
* Critical thinking skills
* Digital marketing and social media savvy
* Excellent organizational skills
* Project management experience

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* How many years of marketing experience within the telecom, broadband, or network operations industry do you have?

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Brand Media
description:
**About Us**



Wild Alaskan Company's mission is to accelerate humanity's transition to sustainable food systems by fostering meaningful, interconnected relationships between human beings, wild seafood and the planet.



We deliver wild-caught, sustainable seafood to households across the United States. Powered by our custom-built eCommerce platform and three generations of history and expertise in the Alaskan fishing industry, we constantly strive to meet our promise of a top-notch product and experience. And we do it all in a fully-remote environment that is fast-paced, challenging, and fun.

**About the Role**



Wild Alaskan Company is seeking a Director of Brand Media to create and lead our brand (above-the-line) media and advertising function. This is a new position within the recently formed Brand function, so you will be getting in at the ground level to help design and scale the strategy. Reporting into the SVP of Brand and initially acting as a scrappy team of one, you will lead everything from the creation of Wild Alaskan Company's brand media strategy, to the planning, buying, and media reporting of brand campaigns.



As Director of Brand Media, you will work in close partnership with the Brand, Marketing, Creative, Data, Finance and Product teams to design and execute full-funnel consumer journeys that drive results for the brand and the business. Ultimately, you will be responsible for creating and serving demand for the brand with new and existing audiences, in new and existing channels.


**About You**



The ideal candidate is someone who is experienced in taking brand and business objectives and translating them into impactful media strategies all while maintaining a test-and-learn mindset with a commitment to ongoing experimentation and optimization.



You will be successful if you are skilled in communications planning, insight development, digital & offline media channels activation and full-funnel measurement. You should also have direct experience creating or optimizing a unified measurement approach across paid media, social/content, influencer, experiential and PR.


**Core Responsibilities**


* Leads the development of long-term brand media strategy, advertising, brand partnerships/sponsorships, while supporting the team in ongoing campaigns and brand/business objectives
* Partners with the marketing and data team to ensure that measurement frameworks, reporting cadences and campaign optimizations are taking place
* Maintains and grows key marketplace relationships, including senior-level media and technology platform contacts.
* Current on media/partnership trends and best practices.
* Oversees the creation of audience journeys, engagement frameworks, campaign ecosystems, etc.
* Manage external partners and resources as needed to deliver on the brand strategy (note that we're looking for the role to manage a majority of the planning/buying with support from the marketing team).
* Oversee brand partnerships, influencer and ambassador programs, and collaborations in partnership with the Brand and Marketing teams.
* Manage the brand media budget to deliver on brand objectives, business KPIs, and audience/member targets.
* Work in close collaboration with the performance and growth marketing teams to ensure "full funnel" cohesion in our media strategy and budgets (ensure that brand media seamlessly feeds into the full-funnel/performance marketing strategy).
* Additional duties as assigned.


**Requirements**


* 10+ years working in media, advertising, brand marketing.
* Creative and courageous media/brand thinker with a proven track record of both leveraging proven strategies, as well as creating new ones that break the mold and achieve results for the brand/business/products.
* Deeply analytical with strong financial acumen and ability to utilize data to optimize investment, messaging, and marketing mix.
* Experience with advocating for and integrating research and insights into campaign planning and strategy development.
* Deep understanding of the evolving media and competitive landscape with a point-of-view on a brand's opportunity and challenges within it.
* Strong relationships with media partners, vendors/agencies, etc.
* Direct experience leading full-funnel campaigns, with proven ability to maximize brand investments by connecting dots between the brand, growth, loyalty, comms and social disciplines.
* Experience planning AND buying media.
* Experience leading media for a mission-led brand and/or brand mission campaigns.


**Nice to Haves**


* Experience with and understanding of current e-commerce strategies and tools
* A passion for sustainability and/or the seafood industry.
* Experience at a rapidly growing start-up.


* *If you have a comparable depth of professional experience, believe your skills are directly transferable, and are passionate about our mission, please apply!*


*The starting salary range for this position is $120,000 - $150,000, commensurate with skills and experience. Wild Alaskan's benefits package includes health, vision, and dental insurance, 401k, PTO, safe/sick time, vacation, parental leave and more, as well as a delicious box of free fish every month.*


Wild Alaskan participates in E-Verify. Please see the Notice of E-Verify Participation and Right to Work posters for more information.


*Diversity of backgrounds and perspectives makes us stronger. We're committed to creating a work environment that fosters growth, celebrates diversity and fundamentally makes all teammates feel welcome, accepted, nurtured and respected.* *As an equal Opportunity Employer, Wild Alaskan Company does not discriminate against candidates on the basis of their disability, sex, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.*

*If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact* ***people@wildalaskancompany.com****. Please note this email cannot provide application status updates.*

title: Senior Brand Manager, NHP & Longevity
description:
**Company Description****:** Instinct® is a rapidly growing, family-owned marketer and manufacturer of science based 100% natural pet food for dogs and cats. Instinct® is the Raw Brand, with a mission to get more raw nutrition into every bowl of dogs and cats, for proven healthier and happier long lives. Our company mission is to Empower people to transform the lives of pets. We are committed to hiring and developing a team of passionate, performance-oriented professionals who live by our 4 values of championing raw, empowered to make a difference, collaborating as one team, and striving for excellence through continuous learning and improvement. Our home office is located in St. Louis, Missouri with our Center of Excellence Raw Food kitchens in Lincoln, Nebraska.
Instinct® is part of the family-owned group, Agrolimen, who owns leading pet food and human food businesses in the US, China, Europe, and Africa.
**Position Summary**:
Our Brand Manager ‘owns the brand’! They play a crucial role in driving Instinct and Longevity household penetration, increasing market share, and strengthening brand health through Neighborhood Pet stores. They are responsible for the development of the annual brand plan, leveraging consumer insights, competitive assessments, market trends, and technologies to ensure the vitality of the Instinct and Longevity portfolios. This person exhibits strong analytical skills, assessing performance across North America, tracking customer sentiment, and measuring activation performance. A team player, this person collaborates closely with innovation, communication, and retail marketing to commercially activate the plan to deliver the brand’s strategic and financial objectives.
**Primary Job Responsibilities:*** Be the Neighborhood Pet category expert understanding the natural pet food industry, the market, the customer, and the competition.
* Ownership of the Longevity assortment, assessing SKU performance, profitability, and portfolio objectives. Lead the analysis and recommendation around portfolio and pricing optimizations. Drive continuous enhancement of brand and product quality that strengthens the brand equity and extends the gap versus competition.
* Prepare monthly business performance analysis and reporting, utilizing internal and external data (e.g. SAP-BI, NielsenIQ, Brand Health Equity Studies etc).
* Lead the development of annual operating and marketing plans. Make recommendations regarding product objectives AND 6Ps strategy assortment (pricing, packaging, promotion, pop media, and positioning activation).
* Commercialize renovations and innovations including go-to market plans (branding, pricing, benchmarks, promotion, etc.), influencing cross functional teams including R&D, Regulatory, Procurement, Demand Planning, Operations, Sales, Finance, Creative, and Integrated Marketing Communications.
* Partner with Integrated Marketing Communications, Retail Marketing, and external agencies to align our media/communications and promotions in support of the brand strategy.
* Initiate creative packaging briefs and ownership of packaging finalization (graphics, materials, size, etc.), website, CRM, and other owned assets.
* Manage the budget/marketing spending to plan and regularly evaluate its effectiveness in driving purchase funnel behaviors linked to brand objectives.

**Personal Attributes:**
* Business Ownership Mindset
* Well developed marketing experience influencing all elements of the marketing mix (product, positioning, packaging, pricing, promotion, and distribution) in a high growth environment.
* Strong leadership and project management skills in order to manage project timelines and cross-functional teams with excellence in execution and strong attention to details.
* Ability to think strategically while executing with excellence.
* Strong analytical skills in using data to make sound recommendations affecting business decisions and results.
* Strong interpersonal skills and team player who empathically supports the cross functional team to commit to performance.
* Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate recommendations in a respectful and fearless manner.
* Highly competitive, with the strong will to win against the competition.
* Strong organizational skills with ability to prioritize and focus on outcomes.

**Preferred Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Advertising, or related field
* 6+ years in brand management or new product development, preferably within CPG.
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills required. Ideally, experience working with syndicated data.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills required.
* High proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

**Travel Requirements:** Requires travel up to 20% of the time. If Remote travel up to 50% of the time.
* In-person meetings at the discretion of the team lead and business needs.
* If based remotely, quarterly travel to Instinct home office in St. Louis, MO.
* Annual travel to Lincoln, Nebraska for Company Rally.

**Compensation and Benefits**
Highly competitive compensation package includes health and dental insurance, life and AD&D insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings account, short and long-term disability, paid time off, Purpose Days off for company partner volunteer opportunities, and 401k with company match**.**
Our *Instinct* is to **CHAMPION** Diversity
At Instinct, we are as passionate about our people as we are about the pets we call family. We are committed to inclusion, empowerment, and respect. We believe that just like our pets, what sets us apart unleashes our greatest strengths. We thrive on the ability to not only empower people to transform the lives of pets through raw nutrition, but also to empower each other to inspire a culture that celebrates our differences. Our unique approach to pet food is what makes us who we are as a company, and our individual identities are what makes us a successful, innovative, authentic team.

title: Brand Manager II
description:
Description:

*For this position, individual must reside in EST time zone of the US.*

 **ABOUT THE COMPANY**


We’ve been building businesses on Amazon for more than 10 years and we continue to be on the forefront as Amazon platforms evolve. We’re uncomfortable calling ourselves experts - since Amazon is always changing, we’re constantly adapting - but the breadth of our knowledge is vast and our team’s diverse experiences elevate our partners’ businesses. We’re marketers, advocates, data scientists, supply chain managers, Amazonians, advertisers and merchants. But most importantly, we’re brand builders. Let’s build brands together.

**POSITION OVERVIEW**


We’re looking for someone who can help drive our clients’ growth to the next level, someone who understands what it takes to drive growth on Amazon, leveraging different tactics and strategies across retail and marketing to help our clients thrive. The ideal candidate will thrive in ambiguity, developing strategies based on deep understandings of the customer, competition, and Amazon capabilities - rooted in data and insights. You will work cross-functionally with internal partners to align on strategy and long-term goals for our clients.

**Responsibilities/Accountabilities**

* Drive overall strategy for the brand, pricing, promotion, new product launches, and how to best advertise a brand and/or product, for small to medium accounts
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients
* Gain a deep understanding of a brand, the competitive landscape, and its key business objectives to deliver growth strategy through qualitative analysis and quantitative data
* Manage the content required to support the product assortment for Amazon; work with internal and external partners to develop approved product imagery and descriptive copy
* Manage brand budgets and profitability
* Stay close to Amazon marketing BETAs and programs that can be leveraged on behalf of our clients
* Help develop media plans, ensure alignment to brand budgets and profitability
* Developing data driven recommendations using relevant sales, market and consumer data
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the strategic growth of Amazon
* Flexibility to contribute at all levels of the business from high-level strategy to the day-to-day hands-on operations
* Utilize insights from multiple sources, endemic and third party, to discover opportunities and strategies and well as assist with strategic reporting needs

**Knowledge/Skills**

* Strong business acumen and inquisitive nature
* A balance to think big and long term, while acting on what it takes to get there
* Ability to learn, understand and converse around key business issues
* A respected and trusted leader with a proven track record of achievement
* Strong decision-making skills and an understanding of where projects fit into overall Company and development strategies
* Demonstrated integrity and maturity and a constructive approach to challenges
* Not afraid of hard conversations and takes them head-on but with tact
* Ability to operate independently given direction, and bring ideas and solutions to issues raised
* Strong passion for both speed and simplicity
* Ability to analyze and assess organizational needs and provide solutions accordingly.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Interpersonal savvy; an ability to effectively work with and connect with all levels of employees across multiple functions and geographies.
* Detail-oriented and operationally-focused
* Ability to motivate teams to produce desired tangible outcomes within tight timeframes
* Strong project planning, tracking & organizing skills
* Takes initiative & brings impeccable follow-up skills
* Strong sense of autonomy
* Demonstrated problem-solving skills
* Demonstrated ability to lead multiple activities and assignments simultaneously.

*Equal Opportunity Employer*

*Sponsorship for work visa unavailable.*


Requirements:
**Qualifications**

* Post-secondary education or equivalent experience in Marketing preferred
* 7+ Years of experience in Brand Management and / or E-Commerce
* Individual resides in EST time zone, preferably in Northeastern United States
* Strong experience working with digital advertising and building media strategy (Amazon Advertising, Facebook, Google, etc.)
* Experience working with internal and external business relationships
* Experienced storyteller – taking all the data and being able to communicate that to the client in a meaningful way
* Strongly preferred: Amazon experience

title: Brand Partnerships Manager
description:
Facet is seeking a talented and experienced Brand Partnerships Manager to join our growing team. As a Brand Partnerships Manager, you will play a key role in developing and executing strategic partnerships that align with Facet's brand and business objectives. You will work closely with internal stakeholders to identify partnership opportunities, negotiate and establish mutually beneficial relationships, and drive measurable results.


You will have a deep understanding of the brand and be able to effectively communicate our value proposition to potential partners. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop creative partnership strategies and execute partnership activations. Your ability to build and maintain strong relationships, identify opportunities, and drive partnerships to success will be critical in this role.


If you have a passion for building meaningful partnerships, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are excited about shaping the future of financial wellness, we would love to hear from you.

### **Responsibilities**

* Identify, evaluate, and pursue new strategic partnership opportunities that align with Facet's brand and business objectives
* Manage end-to-end partnership lifecycle, including sourcing, negotiation, contract development, and ongoing relationship management
* Collaborate with internal teams to develop creative partnership strategies and activations that drive brand awareness and customer acquisition
* Act as the main point of contact for partners, fostering strong relationships and ensuring successful partnership execution
* Monitor and analyze partnership performance, providing regular reporting and insights to internal stakeholders
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends and competitive landscape to identify new partnership opportunities and best practices

**Requirements**

* +5 years of experience in brand partnerships, business development, or related roles
* Proven track record of identifying, negotiating, and executing successful partnerships
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with external partners and internal stakeholders
* Strong business acumen and strategic thinking, with the ability to align partnership opportunities with business objectives
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Experience in the financial services or fintech industry is a plus
* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field

**Benefits**

* $90,000-$105,000 yearly salary based on experience (salary to be determined by the experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, as well as alignment with market data)
* Equity
* Flexible PTO
* All the benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with employer match, short and long term disability coverage (paid by Facet), life insurance options and paid parental leave
* Certification reimbursement program
* Work from anywhere in the US

title: Director of Brand Marketing
description:
**PandaDoc is looking for a Director of Brand Marketing to lead all our brand and creative efforts.** As the Director, Brand Marketing, you will lead a team of creative marketers to define the PandaDoc brand strategy, evangelize our brand story both internally and externally, and lead our integrated content strategy. You'll drive long-term messaging, short-term content goals, and creative generation across the company. You'll partner closely with Product Marketing and Revenue Marketing to design and execute brand campaigns that drive awareness and preference for PandaDoc. Similarly, you'll also partner with the Demand Gen team to execute campaigns inline with our growth goals. Our ideal candidate will be a driven and creative senior leader with a successful track record of building brands and campaigns that drive measurable results with their target audiences. Reporting directly to the VP of Product Marketing & Brand, the Director Brand Marketing must have experience across brand strategy, integrated campaign execution, and media strategy.

  


**In this role you will:**
--------------------------


* Define the Brand Marketing strategy and execution, particularly around building awareness, fame and preference.
* Work with internal and external partners to develop integrated campaign media strategies.
* Collaborate with product marketing and demand generation teams to drive key campaigns.
* Drive our social media strategy.
* Oversee our creative team and creative strategy.
* Act as an advocate for bold and creative thinking, constantly encouraging teams to go beyond the status quo
* Manage and lead an experienced global brand marketing team focused on delivering provocative and engaging messages to the market.

**About you:**
--------------


* 7 years of experience in brand marketing, at least half of which has been in a B2B SaaS environment or startup.
* Understanding of SaaS business models and buyers.
* Experience leading and managing multi-disciplinary marketing teams.
* Demonstrated expertise in driving brand strategy and integrated marketing campaigns.
* A proven track record in creating innovative and targeted brand campaigns and programs that measurably impact campaign metrics.
* A passion for startup culture and rapid change.
* Proven ability to strategically plan, create and implement marketing plans.
* Experience working with C-suite leadership, creating alignment out of ambiguity, and managing executive communications.
* Excellent cross-functional skills to rally multiple internal teams to achieve brand objectives.


**The annual base salary range for this position is $150K - $180K USD**  

**This position is also eligible for a bonus in accordance with the relevant plan documents. The annual bonus opportunity is up to Up to $35K Variable USD**


**Company Overview:**
---------------------



PandaDoc empowers more than 40,000 growing organizations to thrive by taking the work out of document workflow. PandaDoc provides an all-in-one document workflow automation platform that helps fast scaling teams accelerate the ability to create, manage, and sign digital documents including proposals, quotes, contracts, and more. For more information, please visit https://www.pandadoc.com.


**Company Culture:**
--------------------



We're known for our work-life balance, kind co-workers, & creative virtual team-bonding events. And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.



Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency, and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers.



Check out our LinkedIn to learn more.


**Benefits:**
-------------


*Our benefits include tremendous career growth opportunities, a competitive salary, health and commuter benefits, company-paid life & disability, 20+ PTO days, ability to work remotely, 401K and FSA plans, and of course, a fun team of Pandas to work with!*


**PandaDoc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.

  


**EXTERNAL RECRUITERS**


**Approval Requirement**



The use of external recruiters/staffing agencies requires prior approval from our HR Team. The HR Team at PandaDoc requests that external recruiters/staffing agencies not to contact PandaDoc employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Complying with this request will be a factor in determining future professional relationships with PandaDoc.


**Applications Deadline 3/29**

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Marketing Manager
**Job Summary:**
In this newly created role at Daicel Arbor Biosciences, we are looking for a marketing professional who has developed a solid base of experience in marketing communications, including content creation and campaign planning, ideally based on a technical or scientific background. Life sciences experience in particular with molecular biology is preferred. We are looking for strong copywriting experience and proficiency in digital marketing platforms and analytics, as well as confidence in leading event management. A successful candidate will also possess strong project management skills and proven ability to work collaboratively with others. This position will report to the Global Marketing Director and manage a team of two. This role can be based either in-person at our headquarters in Ann Arbor, MI or based remotely, requiring flexibility to travel to headquarters as needed.
**Key responsibilities:**
* Lead all aspects of marketing content delivery, coordinating development with subject matter experts including product managers, the sales team, and customers, and guiding graphic designers and/or agencies as required.
* Create and drive a content calendar that aligns with marketing campaign planning. Help build the strategy that drives content choices.
* Help elevate multi-channel digital marketing execution across our business including all relevant social media platforms, advertising, email, and earned media. The scope of ownership spans both content development and tactical execution, which includes gaining necessary approval, scheduling and posting, and monitoring performance.
* Help define and track campaign KPIs and advise course corrections as needed to optimize ROI. Must be able to extract meaningful takeaways from marketing data to report the “so what” behind the metrics.
* Work with a diverse set of stakeholders to pull together a marcom plan and manage execution. Determine how best to engage and collate ideas, build credibility and exert influence to align efforts. Outline detailed action plans for campaigns with associated budget, timeline and success metrics.
* Manage multi-faceted cross-functional projects effectively to support product launches or other initiatives, leveraging project management skills as needed.
* Lead planning for exhibitions and events, managing a direct report responsible for trade show execution. Work with key stakeholders internally and agencies externally to deliver upon the established goals of attending conferences.
* Monitor and ensure compliance with brand guidelines.


**Person profile:**
* An enthusiastic and hard-working self-starter. High expectations for self and others regarding delivery and performance.
* Naturally curious and customer-orientated, motivated to learn the dynamics of a competitive market.
* Takes pride in excellent communication skills including copywriting and an eye for design. Pays attention to detail and champions brand consistency.
* Strategic thinker who approaches problems with creativity and persistence.
* Keen to quantify results. Comfortable being hands-on with data and reporting out to others.
* Fully fluent in English both verbally and in writing with a polished, articulate style

**Essential skills/experience:**
* At least 5 years’ experience in a marketing role, ideally in a life sciences field. Genomics/NGS experience is not required but will be highly valued.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or a business-related field, or a Bachelor’s degree in a technical/life sciences discipline combined with demonstrated marketing communications experience.
* Proven track record of driving content creation (e.g., marketing collateral, sales tools, app notes, landing pages, ads, videos, and/or event materials). Ideally this will include distilling technical/scientific content into digestible, compelling content suitable for various outputs Examples of your work will be requested.
* Demonstrable expertise in social media marketing. Strong experience should be supported with examples of your work and metrics that demonstrate your success. Must show high proficiency with key platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, LinkedIn Campaign Manager and social management tools such as Hootsuite used in a professional capacity.
* Strong project management skills with an established ability to work effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders to organize and drive multiple workstreams. Proficient working with shared files and the collaborative environment within Microsoft Teams.
* Confidence working with numbers; ability to pull data and structure basic analysis (e.g,. campaign performance). Proficient working in Excel.
* Involvement with (if not ownership of) event planning, ideally on the scale of global exhibitions.
* Management experience is not necessary but must show strong potential and drive to develop others and thrive in a management role.
* Knowledge of relevant content and database laws (e.g., copyright and data protection, GDPR).

  

**Desirable:**
* MBA or marketing qualification
* Exposure to/involvement in web development and management
* Experience with SEO/SEM
* Knowledge of broader principles of brand management
* Basic graphic design skills
* Experience communicating and corresponding directly with customers, verbally and in writing
* Experience working with publishers and/or media outlets in a marketing or PR capacity
* Basic work conducting market research and/or competitive intelligence analysis
* Global experience

**Travel:**
This position may require travel up to 20%.

title: Manager, US Brand Merchandising, Lifestyle - HOKA
description:
At Deckers Brands, Together, Every Step is a promise kept that every employee can bring their authentic self, is valued and supported, as a whole person, at work and beyond. Together, Every Step is how we continue to deliver exceptional business results, experience an amazing place to work, and have a positive impact on the communities and world around us.
Job Title: Manager, US Brand Merchandising, Lifestyle - HOKA  

  

Reports to: Director, US Merchandising - HOKA  

  

Location: Portland, OR (Remote)
Interested applicants must reside in one of the following approved states: Arizona, California, Colorado, Indiana, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Washington
The Role
The Manager, Us Brand Merchandising, Lifestyle will work closely with the Director, US Merchandising on the US strategy for HOKA that encompasses all elements of the value proposition (Right Product at the Right Place at the Right Time for the Right Consumer) specifically for the Lifestyle category and channels in the US. Leveraging Omni-channel and wholesale insights, trend, brand, and category strategies, this person will define the seasonal US consumer right assortments and flow in support of HOKA’s financial goals and strategic brand positioning within our Athletic Specialty, Department Store and Independent Lifestyle access points. They will build relationships with key cross-functional business partners including Sales, Product, Planning, Sales Operations, DTC and Marketing to help support a consistent and compelling brand presentation for the Lifestyle category within the US.
In addition to footwear merchandising leadership, this role will also oversee apparel merchandising for the Lifestyle category in the US, creating a consistent head to toe expression and flow for the brand.
We celebrate diversity-of your background, your experiences and your unique identity. We are committed to ensuring an inclusive and equitable workplace where all of our employees can Come as They Are. We believe that when we bring our different perspectives to work, we are truly Better Together.  

Your Impact  

The primary functions of this role, include but are not limited to:* 1. Lead development of consumer-right assortments, segmentation, and flow of product for the category. Ensuring assortments deliver on the consumer requirements and financial targets for the US Lifestyle category.

* 2. Cross functional collaboration. Ensure all US teams and key stakeholders across product, marketing, sales, are appropriately engaged in their part in the delivery of the assortment strategy.

* 3. Thoroughly understand the competitive landscape and HOKA’s unique point of difference. Drive future needs to ensure the US Lifestyle business continues to deliver innovative product and flawless execution to our consumers.

* 4. Present the US Lifestyle merchandise strategy, supporting insights, assortment guidance and differentiation plans to leadership during key GTM milestone meetings and to customers during preline and presell meetings.


Who You Are* Strong business acumen - continuously evaluates competitors and the marketplace within the Lifestyle category/ appropriate channels to creatively capitalize on market opportunities and product assortments.
* Persuasive communicator with proven negotiation and influencing skills; easily adapts to needs of different audiences.
* Experience influencing in a matrixed environment; drive alignment between product, sales, and marketing.
* Experience designing and delivering compelling presentations for small and large audiences.


We’d love to hear from people with* Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* 5-7 years of Lifestyle specific Sales, Merchandising, or similar experience in a Footwear & Apparel brand preferred.
* Cross-functional experience required, with the ability to build a collaborative, supportive operating environment.


What We'll Give You* Competitive Pay and Bonuses - We’ve created a variety of competitive compensation programs to foster career development, reward success and to show our employees just how much they’re valued.
* Financial Planning and wellbeing - No matter what financial goals our employees have set, we want to help them get there. Our plans provide powerful ways to protect income, pay for expenses and invest in the future.
* Time away from work - Sometimes we need time away to be with family, focus on our health or just simply recharge. Our plans support our employees’ needs to get out, get healthy and come back stronger than ever.
* Extras, discounts and perks - Being a valued member of the Deckers Brands team means more than just a paycheck. From generous discounts to community-based programs, we offer a variety of cool extras
* Growth and Development - Deckers Brands was built on the idea of pursuing passion. That’s why we offer extensive opportunities and support for personal and professional development.
* Health and Wellness - There’s nothing basic about our comprehensive health and wellness programs and offerings. While at work and at play, we aim to support a healthy lifestyle.

  

$120,000-$125,000
The salary range posted reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this role in our Goleta, CA location. Individual pay will be determined by location and additional factors, including job related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary for your preferred location during the hiring process.  

Equal Employment Opportunity  

Diversity and inclusion are key to our success. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds who share a passion for our brands. We welcome qualified applicants regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, military or veteran status, mental or physical disability, medical condition and all of the other beautiful parts of your identity.
#LI-EL1

title: Sr. Brand Manager
description:
Rosewood is looking for a strategic and entrepreneurial Sr. Brand Manager who is excited about the ever-evolving world of social media and web services. The ideal candidate is passionate and looking to move their career forward within a dynamic, fast-paced, and growing creative agency.

**What Your Day to Day will Look Like**

* Act as the primary point of contact for client(s); communicate regularly with client on status, timeline, monthly scope, deliverables, performance reporting, and other follow-up items.
* Take responsibility for overall brand health and client happiness.
* Develop a deep understanding of client digital and social initiatives to concept deliverables that best meet, optimize and add value.
* Ideate opportunities to improve efficiencies and client relationships.
* Creates budgets, proposals and SOWs in partnership with Strategy and Project Management team.
* Lead and optimize communication across the internal team. Go above and beyond to promote positive workflows and oversee process and quality control across all projects from ideation through execution.
* Oversee day-to-day tactical initiatives for the client’s business; maintain a focus on the short-term deliverables while comprehending the client’s long-term goals.
* Maintain and grow positive relationships and build confidence among clients and internal teams.
* Proactively solve potential challenges for all production projects and general brand management.
* Lead external contractor communication, asset delivery and invoicing.
* Always have your finger on the pulse of entertainment culture.

**Requirements**

* 5-7 years of social media or brand marketing experience in advertising, social/digital, or entertainment industries.
* Experience working on projects that involve web development and design is a plus.
* Strong ability to understand our client’s needs and become their trusted advisor.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills, presentation skills, and the ability to prioritize and multitask complex projects simultaneously.
* Mastery of brand management with strong leadership qualities.
* Excellent analytical skills, commitment to client objectives, and proven ability to manage expectations.
* Master of the social (especially TikTok) and digital ecosystem and how brands should participate in an authentic way.
* Ability to collaborate effectively at all levels and functions.
* Strategic and creative thinker who can proactively problem solve.
* Solid experience utilizing Google Slides and Keynote to build captivating presentations.

**Benefits**

* Flexible-Paid Time Off (F-PTO)
* Sick Time
* Paid Parental Leave
* Paid Holidays - Including the Last Week of the Year
* Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance
* Optional Flexible Spending Account
* Company Matching 401(k)
* Wellness Reimbursements
* Remote Working

**Salary:** $95,000 - $115,000 annually

* *This organization participates in E-Verify.*

title: Director, Brand & Integrated Marketing
description:
#### **Director, Brand & Integrated Marketing**



As the Director of Brand & Integrated Marketing, you will lead the transformation of the way we bring our brand to life across all consumer touchpoints and lead go-to-market launches. You will innovate within our current brand channels, with an emphasis on social and brand partnerships, in how we present our brands. You will serve as the leader in helping to establish the brand as a key strategy to help deliver upon our long-term growth goals. Above all, you embody the Thirty Madison mission of providing access to healthcare for all those who suffer from chronic conditions.


#### **Comp | Perks | Benefits**


* The base pay range for this position is $160,800 - $197,000 per year \\*\\*
* Competitive Salary + Annual Incentive Plan + Stock Option Package
* Robust and affordable Health, Dental, and Vision plan options
* 401k with a match, commuter benefits, and FSA
* Annual $750 vacation stipend and $500 happiness stipend
* Flexible time off policy
* Career growth opportunities


*\\*\\*Base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. An annual incentive plan and stock options may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.*


#### **What you get to do everyday**


* Lead brand strategy and brand architecture work for Thirty Madison's consumer-facing brands, including Keeps and Nurx, finding the right balance between strong business performance and brand equity
* Own strategy and execution for top-of-funnel brand awareness campaigns to help drive brand discovery for prospective patients
* Build and deliver the organic marketing strategy for our in-marketing brands, partnering closely with the growth team to ensure continuity and clarity on the patient journey
* Leader on all GTM strategies; you will ensure the success of all new product launches, including driving insights-driven 360 launch plans, messaging strategies, process work, and more
* Uplevel the social presence for Thirty Madison's consumer-facing brands by defining an innovative social media and community-building strategy
* Lead and coordinate content development for key patient touchpoints to ensure one voice and one vision
* Ensure a consistent message and brand voice is delivered across all marketing channels, including performance, to defend a strong, differentiated brand presence in a highly competitive marketplace
* Keep current on top of industry trends, cultural dynamics, and digital innovation; drive internal advocacy for new and innovative approaches
* With the help of the VP of Marketing, establish how we measure brand performance and highlight the impact it can drive on the business
* Manage and coach a talented cross-functional team of integrated marketing managers, social media managers, and more

#### **What you bring to the role**


* 7+ years of experience in brand-side marketing or brand management
* You are a brand-first marketing champion and creative professional who can push and advocate for brand thinking; you have a passion for brand storytelling and a foundational marketing skill set
* Ability to rally a diverse cross-functional team around a common vision
* Highly collaborative and equal parts strategic and tactical, creative and analytical
* Creative thinker with an exceptional track record of developing holistic marketing strategies and plans that have consistently met or exceeded planned results
* Ability to contribute to the strategic vision of the organization by aligning brand strategy with broader business goals and objectives
* Strong project management skills
* Experience translating data into insights and ideas into briefs
* Comfort working in a cross-functional team environment, fostering collaboration and ensuring the integration of patient insights into various business functions
* Strong project management skills with a proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely and high-quality deliverables
* Experience and capability to mentor and develop a high-performing team of marketers, while also driving forward workstreams on your own
* Ability to foster a culture of positive intent, continuous learning, and professional growth within the team

**U.S. Applicants Only**


**Don't meet every single requirement?** Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Thirty Madison we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.


*We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.*



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions. Contact us at recruiting@thirtymadison.com to request accommodation.


#### **About Thirty Madison**



Thirty Madison is a family of specialized healthcare brands devoted to creating exceptional outcomes for all. Each of its specialized brands is focused on a specific ongoing condition, and thoughtfully designed to support the unique needs of its community with personalized treatments and care; with Keeps for men's hair loss, Cove for migraine, Facet for skin conditions, and NURX for sexual health. With empathy at the heart of its innovation, its proprietary care model empowers hundreds of thousands of people with ongoing conditions with the accessible, effective treatments across a lifetime of care. In just four years, we've built a number of brands and are continuing to grow rapidly, recently raised a $140m Series C, and are backed by some of the best healthcare and consumer investors, including HealthQuest Capital, Mousse Partners, Bracket Capital, Polaris Partners, Johnson & Johnson, Maveron, Northzone, among others.



We are honored to become Great Place to Work certified and be included on BuiltIn's 2021 list of Best Places To Work in New York City, and Best Midsize Companies To Work For. We've also been recognized by Forbes' Best Startup Employers, being named as one of America's Best Places to Work 2022. This recognition is a true testament to our hardworking team and company culture. As we continue to grow, we pride ourselves on finding passionate individuals who truly embody our core values and mission each and every day. Learn more at ThirtyMadison.com.



\\*This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your I-9 Form information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.\\*


* **Please be aware that there are fraudulent entities who are falsely claiming to be or represent Thirty Madison in order to solicit sensitive personal information or payment. Thirty Madison is not in any way associated with these entities or practices. The safety and integrity of those seeking employment with us is of the utmost importance and we actively work with our legal and security teams to prevent future incidents.**


**Thirty Madison will never ask for sensitive information or payment when engaging with job seekers. The entities use many methods to perpetuate these scams, including but not limited to: participating in a text-only interview, using Thirty Madison's trademarks on their correspondence, or providing you with a seemingly legitimate offer letter. If you suspect you are a victim of this scamming, we encourage you to cease further contact and report the crime to** **The Federal Trade Commission****.**

title: Director, Brand Partnerships (Media Sales)
description:
Blavity, Inc. is a venture-funded media and technology company, founded in 2014 around a simple idea: enable Black millennials to tell their own stories. Today, we are home to the largest network of platforms and lifestyle brands serving the multifaceted lives of Black millennials & Gen Z through original content, video, unique experiences, and product solutions. Blavity Inc. has evolved into a market leader for Black media, reaching 250 million users per month through our growing brand portfolio, including Blavity, Blavity360º, Shadow & Act, AfroTech & Talent Infusion, 21Ninety, Travel Noire, and Home & Texture. Our Blavity, Inc. employee community is composed of passionate, energetic, and culturally conscious individuals working together to deliver value to each other, the company, and our clients. We are always searching for new additions to our community that will help us continue to scale, contribute meaningfully to our culture, and advance our strategic direction.

**Job Summary:**


Blavity Inc. seeks a top-performing Director of Brand Partnerships to lead a sales pod to consultatively sell Blavity services to advertisers and partners. This is a sales leadership role with a sales incentive plan. Frequently sold products include integrated marketing programs and branded content across desktop, mobile, video, social media, and live events. You will manage a team of Business Development Managers to achieve quarterly and annual sales targets, provide direction for sales and product strategies, and develop strategic relationships with key client accounts.


This role will report directly to the Chief Revenue Officer.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead a team of 3-5 Blavity Business Development Managers to achieve annual and quarterly sales revenue goals across digital and experiential sales products
	+ Maintain a cadence of weekly 1:1 and team sales meeting
	+ Facilitate key introductions, and appropriately distribute inbound leads to Sales team
* Personally manage your own book of business for strategic accounts from new relationships with key brands and agencies
* Prepare monthly sales reports, forecast and manage pipeline using Salesforce tools, and communicate clear reporting to senior management and executives
* Act as a leader across entire sales cycle, including demand generation, qualification, opportunity management, and contract closure
* Meet or exceed team revenue goals on quarterly basis across web, mobile, video, content, social media, and live events

**Qualifications:**

* Education: B.A
* Required Experience:
	+ 6+ years of experience in media business development
	+ 3+ years of experience managing and coaching mid-level employees
	+ Deep experience driving and representing a digital-first or diversified media company
* Preferred Experience:
	+ Demonstrated ability to grow revenue while putting audience, story-telling and community first
* Technologies: Fluent in Microsoft Office, Google Suite, Salesforce, Asana, and/or comparable project management suite
* Additional Qualifications:
	+ Excellent communication skills, able to take complex information and succinctly and effectively communicate both in verbal and written formats
	+ Demonstrated ability to set, manage, and track against a set of diverse, strategic KPIs
	+ Strong analytical mind with demonstrated experience tracking core business metrics and driving decisions based on that data
	+ A healthy appreciation of GIFs and Black culture

**Details:**

* This is a fully remote role, U.S.- based role. Occasional travel may be required.
* Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S.
* **Candidates must be available to work 50% in alignment with the Central Time Zone.**
* The annual salary range for this role is $130,000 - $145,000.


To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter online at BlavityInc.com/Careers.

*Blavity is committed to creating a diverse environment free of discrimination and harassment, and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.*

*Blavity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, HIV Status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.*
